story:
Painting The City Bright will create huge awareness for Uganda and the City of Jinja, for all the positives it has to offer. Painting The City Bright will lift the country on the international map. People all over the world will recognise Uganda and Jinja for something beautiful. A great tourist destination, a city with huge business potential, a thriving culture and a lot more.

Most of all Painting The City Bright will inspire and create opportunities for the People of Uganda.

www.paintingthecitybright.com

Jinja has so much to offer and best of all is the people of Jinja whom make others feel happy, just by being around them. This is the best medicine to heal the heart and spirit of most people on this planet. The Mayor of Jinja asked Big Steve to come and help him show of his city to the rest of the world and this is our story.

We decided that the best way to create awareness of Jinja was to do something that everyone in Jinja could be involved in. The Center piece of this campaign is that everyone would feel welcome and free to take part, or be a part of history happening right on their own door step. The idea developed is open to the entire community, Painting The City Bright. This would make Jinja the ‘most colourful city in Africa’ and by taking part, would be something that residents of Jinja could feel proud to be part of.



Why are we doing this?

This campaign is very important to us, Jinja And UGANDA has been known for a lot of negatives over several years. We all know that every country and City has their negatives, but they also have their Positive. So we made a promise to help the Mayor of Jinja and the people of Uganda to reach out to the world and show that Jinja has a lot to offer and that the People on Jinja are the happiest people in the world. It's time to put Jinja back on the map, and on the right road to success.

We are all volunteers working on this project, the money we are asking for all goes to covering expenses to bring the team of 12 to the equator. And to help out with all the expenses these 3 BIG events will cost.


 

The Events Happening in MAY.

May 4 2013 – Big Hearts Create Big Smiles #bhcbs2013

The program begins with a relay from Jinja to Northern Sweden, where glass bottles shaped like Uganda’s delicious Nile Perch fish and like hippos, will be filled with water from the source of the Nile and then carried, on and adjacent to the Nile, over the Mediterranean and Europe, ending up in Skellefteå in Northen Sweden.

During the trip, there will be a variety of cultural events with music and dance from Jinja. By 2014, the glass bottles are expected to have reached Northern Sweden and will be given to Mayors of various municipalities.

This will be a great opportunity to sell Jinja’s potential because its at that time that the city of Umeå in Västerbotten county in Sweden would have taken over as the European Capital of Culture.

 

11 May 2013 – African Ice Swimming Championships

History will be written in Jinja, when The First African Ice Swimming Championship is staged, an event that officials of Jinja Municipal Council have said will be like bringing the polar circle to the equator. Jinja residents have been inspired to undertake this from the city of Skellefteå in Northern Sweden, where, for the last two years both The Swedish and Scandinavian championship in winter swimming were held.

The water temperature in the swimming pool will be lowered to about 10 ° C, a rare phenomenon at the equator, for the championship to take place. Both individual races and relays are on the program.

 

17-18 May 2013 – Painting the city bright #ptcb2013

Thousands of people will paint 66 houses on Main Street in cheerful colors. Here, men and women, boys and girls will go out on the street and grabs brushes to brighten their city. On painting day there will even be a carnival on the Main Street with lots of musicians, dancers and other types of artists including world class reggae artists

Read More here:
Website
Facebook
 

This Campaing was created by Knights of the North AB and BIG STEVE FROM ENGLAND

Painting The CIty Bright has received assistance with crowdfunding advice & marketing through the Innovative Distribution Program run by FanDependent.

story:
Q.  Who are you?
A. I’m a fine art photographer based in Maine.  I’ve got the same laundry list of ridiculous day jobs (that thankfully I don’t work at anymore) that most artists have as well as a resume  (if you’re into that kind of thing) of all my artistic achievements.

Q.  Are you really photographing all your friends on Facebook?
A. Yes! I made a spread sheet of where everyone lived on February 24, 2011. At that time I had 626 friends, and I am off to photograph them all!  I’ve traveled to 15 states, photographed over 250 people,  made 168 portraits, received international press and transformed the project from one that existed only on the internet to an exhibition at the Portland Museum of Art

Q.  That is a lot of people and traveling, how have you funded it so far?
A. It has been almost entirely crowd funded by you (150+ !!) with a little grant money and a part time day job.

Q.  I want to know more about this, do you have a statement?
A.  Yes!   I have posted the about statement and press releases.  I have also done a ton of interviews which tend to be more up to date on my thoughts, since I'm continually learning from the process. You can read, watch or listen. 

Q.  Wow, what an adventure you’re on.   How can I be part of this?
A.  You can donate your cold hard cash to the project.  I have so many great things to offer as incentives:  I'll send you a postcard from the road, give you any photograph you want,  I'll add you to the project, I'll talk to you, your business or school about the project, social media or photography. I've got Portland Museum of Art merchandise & exhibition mementos.   For $125, I am giving away your choice of 10x10" magnets from the exhibition.  I am also committed to re-investing 10% of my income back into the arts community.  My work would not be possible if I wasn't surrounded by amazingly inspiring & talented artists.  Here is a sampling of the great things from my friends I am including for contributions of $50 or more.

IF you have too much stuff already, skip the perks and get a tax deduction!  Are you really my friend? is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the purposes of Are you really my friend? must be made payable to Fractured Atlas and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.   

AND, even if you can’t invest cold hard cash, please take a few minutes to spread the word on your social media platform of choice and by e-mailing all your friends!  Especially your friends that work at Facebook.

Q.   This project is so awesome, I want to underwrite the whole thing.  Will $100, 000 cover it?  Where should I send the check?
A.   First, thank you so much for understanding awesome costs money (as my friend Jenny would say).  And second, I think 100K just might do it.  It will certainly cover the next year.  You don’t have to send it, I’d love to pick up the check and thank you personally for being so awesome yourself.

Q.  I’m getting tired of all your fundraisers.  Can’t you just get a real job and leave us all alone?
A.  Me too.   And NO.

Q.   I really love your landscape work, but want to support this project.  Can I choose a landscape as one of my incentives?
A.  YES!  You can choose whatever you want from any of my photographs.  Maybe it’s a mobile upload from Facebook, Instagram, my blog, or website.  My online world is your oyster.

Q.  I want a $1, 000 incentive but can’t afford it all at once, would you consider a payment plan?
A.  Unfortunately there is not a way to set that up for this campaign.  But if you e-mail me your thoughts, I will try and work with you.   I am all about making art affordable.

Q.  I am asked to donate to a lot of causes, why should I donate to yours?
A.    I want to talk about language before I answer that question.   I like to think of this cause as investing in my future.  You are giving me money, and I am giving you my art.  If you are giving me straight up cash and taking the tax write off, then you are making a donation.  Back to why you should invest.  You should invest because you think my work has value.  Because you think this project has value.  Because you think my time should be spent making beautiful things and sharing them with the world.   The bottom line is I am out of funds to continue this project, so any amount you can contribute brings me one step closer to making another photograph.

Q.   $60, 000 seems a lot of money.  Why don’t you set a more realistic goal?
A.  You’re totally right.  Unfortunately (or fortunately), I’ve never been one to set realistic goals.  I have raised 50K over the last year, so I believe it’s possible.  It has been difficult to fundraise and make the work at the same time, so I want to dedicate myself to fundraising for one month and then be able to work for a year uninterrupted.

Q.   What are you going to with all the money you raise?  I’m crunching some numbers in my head and I can’t see how you could possibly need this much money.
A.  That’s a good question, obviously.   I’ll tell you right now, the first thing I’m going to buy is 300 rolls of film before they discontinue film completely.  I am also going to buy a new computer.  My 2006 Macbook is barely hanging on.  And in the tradition of full disclosure, I have made my budget a public spreadsheet and will track the projects income & expenses for you to see.   I will at minimum be updating it monthly.

Q.   I think it’s reasonable to ask for your expenses, but why should I pay for your salary, that seems crazy?
A.   Truth be told, photography is expensive, and so is travel.  But actually the most expensive line item,  my time, is my most valuable asset.  Artists are told over and over again that their time is not valuable, I would like to break that cycle of thinking.

Q.  It's so great the Portland Museum of Art exhibited the project and is adding passes, membership & merchadise to your incentives.  Are you going to give them a photograph for thier collection?
A.  If this campaign is successful, I will archive the entire project at the Portland Museum of Art.   Every time the piece is exhibited, the wall label will have your name on it.   I think it could be the largest crowd funded Museum acquisition in history.

Q.  What happens if you exceed your fundraising goal?
A.  Another great question.  This budget is for a year, however it could take much longer, any extra money will be used to bring the project to fruition.  I would also lke to hire assistants to help with scheduling, post production and promotion.  I have grand ideas of creating a book, which is a very expensive task.

Q.  It seems that you are having a great time making this work.  You get to see your old friends, make new ones, eat & drink, go to Museums, and travel all the time.   Why should I fund you to go on vacation? I’m jealous, I want your experiences.
A.  It’s true!  I am having a lot of fun.  I love what I am doing.  And everyone, including you should love what they do for work and have fun doing it.    This project is also really hard work and has consumed my whole life (in the best possible way).  It can be exhausting and emotionally draining as well.   But back to the fun part, you shouldn’t be jealous.  Quit your job, hit the road, do you what you love!

Q.  How long will it take you to finish the project?
A.   I think about a year.   It is really hard for me to estimate because at times the project takes on a life of its own and spins in many different directions.   I am creeping close to the half way mark and I have been at it a little over a year.  I was working part time during that time period and launching multiple fundraisers, and also took four months off of shooting to prepare and install the exhibition at the Portland Museum of Art.  

Q.  You must have some good stories to tell.  Are your writing about this?
A.  Yes!  This project has taken me to see many people & places I would never of imagined visiting.  I am documenting it all on my blog which I am starting to realize is as important as the finished portrait.   It’s modern day journal of our collective histories.   

Q.   Do you have Facebook friends that you haven’t met in real life?
A. Yes!  In fact, on a recent trip to Houston, I stayed with one.   She welcomed me, left me the keys to her place and said maker your self at home.  I am learning how amazing we all are, how we form communities and support each other, how we are inherently kind and generous.

Q. Why are you going to their homes? It seems like the easy thing to do would be to rent a studio and have every one come to you.
A. I know, right?  Sometimes I really wish I was one of those people that could do things the easy way.   This project is an exploration into friendship, and to me a friend is someone you share a meal with and have heated discussions after a few bottles of wine.  So, it's a huge part of the project that I go and visit with friends in their own environments.

Q.  Where is the farthest you have gone and where is the farthest you will go?
A.   The farthest I’ve been is Los Angeles and the farthest place I have to go is Auckland, New Zealand.  Which is WHY I’m asking for your help now.  I plan to do it one fell swoop, by crossing the Atlantic to Africa and then stopping in Europe, the Middle East, Asia and New Zealand and back around across the Pacific.

Q.  How are you going to schedule that?
A.  I have no idea, it is giving me a little anxiety just thinking about it.  It is hard enough to plan in American cities, I can't imagine what it will be like in foreign languages.

Q.  How long do you think it will take you to go all the way around the world?
A.  If I don't stop to see the sights, I could probably do it in a month.  I would like to allot myself about four months (hopefully leaving Maine for the winter) to really see the world. And of course, show and tell you all about it.

Q.   What do your days look like?  How much time do you spend shooting vs. travelling vs. promotion vs. production?
A.  That is a great question.  My days have been very long, usually around 12-14 hours, 7 days a week.  I'd like to get them down to 10 hours!  I wondered the same thing myself when I was putting this campaign together.  I decided to start tracking my time on this public calendar so you can see in real time.   Over the past year, I averaged about two weeks a month travelling/shooting, and the other two post production (scanning, blogging, printing).   It feels like the blogging is the most time consuming part but maybe that’s just because it is the hardest.

I love hearing from you.  Please feel free to E-MAIL  me.
story_txt:
Q.  Who are you?A. I’m a fine art photographer based in Maine.  I’ve got the same laundry list of ridiculous day jobs (that thankfully I don’t work at anymore) that most artists have as well as a resume  (if you’re into that kind of thing) of all my artistic achievements.Q.  Are you really photographing all your friends on Facebook?A. Yes! I made a spread sheet of where everyone lived on February 24, 2011. At that time I had 626 friends, and I am off to photograph them all!  I’ve traveled to 15 states, photographed over 250 people,  made 168 portraits, received international press and transformed the project from one that existed only on the internet to an exhibition at the Portland Museum of Art
Q.  That is a lot of people and traveling, how have you funded it so far?A. It has been almost entirely crowd funded by you (150+ !!) with a little grant money and a part time day job.
Q.  I want to know more about this, do you have a statement?A.  Yes!   I have posted the about statement and press releases.  I have also done a ton of interviews which tend to be more up to date on my thoughts, since I'm continually learning from the process. You can read, watch or listen. 
Q.  Wow, what an adventure you’re on.   How can I be part of this?A.  You can donate your cold hard cash to the project.  I have so many great things to offer as incentives:  I'll send you a postcard from the road, give you any photograph you want,  I'll add you to the project, I'll talk to you, your business or school about the project, social media or photography. I've got Portland Museum of Art merchandise & exhibition mementos.   For $125, I am giving away your choice of 10x10" magnets from the exhibition.  I am also committed to re-investing 10% of my income back into the arts community.  My work would not be possible if I wasn't surrounded by amazingly inspiring & talented artists.  Here is a sampling of the great things from my friends I am including for contributions of $50 or more.
IF you have too much stuff already, skip the perks and get a tax deduction!  Are you really my friend? is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the purposes of Are you really my friend? must be made payable to Fractured Atlas and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.   AND, even if you can’t invest cold hard cash, please take a few minutes to spread the word on your social media platform of choice and by e-mailing all your friends!  Especially your friends that work at Facebook.
Q.   This project is so awesome, I want to underwrite the whole thing.  Will $100, 000 cover it?  Where should I send the check?A.   First, thank you so much for understanding awesome costs money (as my friend Jenny would say).  And second, I think 100K just might do it.  It will certainly cover the next year.  You don’t have to send it, I’d love to pick up the check and thank you personally for being so awesome yourself.
Q.  I’m getting tired of all your fundraisers.  Can’t you just get a real job and leave us all alone?A.  Me too.   And NO.Q.   I really love your landscape work, but want to support this project.  Can I choose a landscape as one of my incentives?A.  YES!  You can choose whatever you want from any of my photographs.  Maybe it’s a mobile upload from Facebook, Instagram, my blog, or website.  My online world is your oyster.
Q.  I want a $1, 000 incentive but can’t afford it all at once, would you consider a payment plan?A.  Unfortunately there is not a way to set that up for this campaign.  But if you e-mail me your thoughts, I will try and work with you.   I am all about making art affordable.
Q.  I am asked to donate to a lot of causes, why should I donate to yours?A.    I want to talk about language before I answer that question.   I like to think of this cause as investing in my future.  You are giving me money, and I am giving you my art.  If you are giving me straight up cash and taking the tax write off, then you are making a donation.  Back to why you should invest.  You should invest because you think my work has value.  Because you think this project has value.  Because you think my time should be spent making beautiful things and sharing them with the world.   The bottom line is I am out of funds to continue this project, so any amount you can contribute brings me one step closer to making another photograph.Q.   $60, 000 seems a lot of money.  Why don’t you set a more realistic goal?A.  You’re totally right.  Unfortunately (or fortunately), I’ve never been one to set realistic goals.  I have raised 50K over the last year, so I believe it’s possible.  It has been difficult to fundraise and make the work at the same time, so I want to dedicate myself to fundraising for one month and then be able to work for a year uninterrupted.Q.   What are you going to with all the money you raise?  I’m crunching some numbers in my head and I can’t see how you could possibly need this much money.A.  That’s a good question, obviously.   I’ll tell you right now, the first thing I’m going to buy is 300 rolls of film before they discontinue film completely.  I am also going to buy a new computer.  My 2006 Macbook is barely hanging on.  And in the tradition of full disclosure, I have made my budget a public spreadsheet and will track the projects income & expenses for you to see.   I will at minimum be updating it monthly.Q.   I think it’s reasonable to ask for your expenses, but why should I pay for your salary, that seems crazy?A.   Truth be told, photography is expensive, and so is travel.  But actually the most expensive line item,  my time, is my most valuable asset.  Artists are told over and over again that their time is not valuable, I would like to break that cycle of thinking.
Q.  It's so great the Portland Museum of Art exhibited the project and is adding passes, membership & merchadise to your incentives.  Are you going to give them a photograph for thier collection?A.  If this campaign is successful, I will archive the entire project at the Portland Museum of Art.   Every time the piece is exhibited, the wall label will have your name on it.   I think it could be the largest crowd funded Museum acquisition in history.
Q.  What happens if you exceed your fundraising goal?A.  Another great question.  This budget is for a year, however it could take much longer, any extra money will be used to bring the project to fruition.  I would also lke to hire assistants to help with scheduling, post production and promotion.  I have grand ideas of creating a book, which is a very expensive task.
Q.  It seems that you are having a great time making this work.  You get to see your old friends, make new ones, eat & drink, go to Museums, and travel all the time.   Why should I fund you to go on vacation? I’m jealous, I want your experiences.A.  It’s true!  I am having a lot of fun.  I love what I am doing.  And everyone, including you should love what they do for work and have fun doing it.    This project is also really hard work and has consumed my whole life (in the best possible way).  It can be exhausting and emotionally draining as well.   But back to the fun part, you shouldn’t be jealous.  Quit your job, hit the road, do you what you love!
Q.  How long will it take you to finish the project?A.   I think about a year.   It is really hard for me to estimate because at times the project takes on a life of its own and spins in many different directions.   I am creeping close to the half way mark and I have been at it a little over a year.  I was working part time during that time period and launching multiple fundraisers, and also took four months off of shooting to prepare and install the exhibition at the Portland Museum of Art.   Q.  You must have some good stories to tell.  Are your writing about this?A.  Yes!  This project has taken me to see many people & places I would never of imagined visiting.  I am documenting it all on my blog which I am starting to realize is as important as the finished portrait.   It’s modern day journal of our collective histories.   Q.   Do you have Facebook friends that you haven’t met in real life?A. Yes!  In fact, on a recent trip to Houston, I stayed with one.   She welcomed me, left me the keys to her place and said maker your self at home.  I am learning how amazing we all are, how we form communities and support each other, how we are inherently kind and generous.Q. Why are you going to their homes? It seems like the easy thing to do would be to rent a studio and have every one come to you.A. I know, right?  Sometimes I really wish I was one of those people that could do things the easy way.   This project is an exploration into friendship, and to me a friend is someone you share a meal with and have heated discussions after a few bottles of wine.  So, it's a huge part of the project that I go and visit with friends in their own environments.Q.  Where is the farthest you have gone and where is the farthest you will go?A.   The farthest I’ve been is Los Angeles and the farthest place I have to go is Auckland, New Zealand.  Which is WHY I’m asking for your help now.  I plan to do it one fell swoop, by crossing the Atlantic to Africa and then stopping in Europe, the Middle East, Asia and New Zealand and back around across the Pacific.Q.  How are you going to schedule that?A.  I have no idea, it is giving me a little anxiety just thinking about it.  It is hard enough to plan in American cities, I can't imagine what it will be like in foreign languages.
Q.  How long do you think it will take you to go all the way around the world?A.  If I don't stop to see the sights, I could probably do it in a month.  I would like to allot myself about four months (hopefully leaving Maine for the winter) to really see the world. And of course, show and tell you all about it.Q.   What do your days look like?  How much time do you spend shooting vs. travelling vs. promotion vs. production?A.  That is a great question.  My days have been very long, usually around 12-14 hours, 7 days a week.  I'd like to get them down to 10 hours!  I wondered the same thing myself when I was putting this campaign together.  I decided to start tracking my time on this public calendar so you can see in real time.   Over the past year, I averaged about two weeks a month travelling/shooting, and the other two post production (scanning, blogging, printing).   It feels like the blogging is the most time consuming part but maybe that’s just because it is the hardest.
I love hearing from you.  Please feel free to E-MAIL  me.

story:
My Story 

 

My Upbringing

Like many Chinese families, my parents like to compare me with other kids all the time. I always think there is nothing I can do in life will ever please them and make them proud of me. I remember one thing my parents constantly told me is that dream can’t buy you food.  You have to get a stable job that provides you security.  Don’t chase after something that won’t earn you money.

Praying for Change

My life is simple and routine.  I have a full time job which I have worked for 10 years.  However, I do not enjoy it at all.  No passion.  No satisfaction.  I know that I have talent and passion for art; however, I do not dare to pursue it.  So life went on, but I was not happy at all.  Last October, I started to pray for a change to happen.  I wanted to do something different, most importantly something I enjoy doing.  God has answered my prayer. Instead of giving me a new job, He gave me a talent and passion to sew.  Something I have never thought of doing before but now I just fall in love with it.  It is such an amazing and a rewarding experience to know that people like my felted goods.  I never knew that I can do something to touch and inspire people like this with my hands. From then I knew my courage is back. And it's time to chase after the long forgetten dreams …

Making My Dream Comes True

One of my dreams is to open an art gallery to exhibit my art works. I believe it’s not only my dream, but it’s also a dream for every artists out there. Through my works, I want to tell people about my story, what I see and what inspires me in life. Therefore, I am asking for your help. Your support and pledge are greatly appreciated and important to make this big dream happen.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute financially, that doesn’t mean you can’t help.  Here are few ways you can do to help:

  • Ask people around you (friends, families, co-workers, etc.) to get the word out about my campaign.

  • Visit my Facebook page and "LIKE" me at http://www.facebook.com/feltinluv

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Again, Thank you for your support and hope to see you all in my first exhibition!

story:
Art on Wheels!

Go Art Go is an innovative art space and supply shop housed in a vintage Airstream trailer, bringing quality education by professional artists and unique entertainment literally to your front door.

Go Art Go is an innovative enrichment space for children and adults housed in a vintage Airstream trailer.  Being mobile will allow us to provide limitless opportunities in art education. Go Art Go will travel to schools to provide enriching after-school programs in art education. It can be parked in neighborhoods for parents who are looking for creative summer craft camps for their kids. The Go Art Go trailer can also be for rented for private functions, baby showers, playdates, seasonal workshops and even girls night out. The mobile art school is not limited to one geographical region. Go Art Go will travel to festivals and events all over the state of Texas and beyond, offering our unique experience in art making.

The Go Art Go trailer will also house a retail store, where our customers can purchase items such as handmade art smocks, supply organizers and unique art materials. These products will also be available in our online store.

Go Art Go is more than about making crafty items or pretty paintings. Here, art is about discovering a personal vision through the creative journey. Learning about and making art is process-focused, rather than seen as a deliverable or end product. It is also about building a stronger community, collaborating creatively and encouraging people of all ages and levels of expertise to inspire one another. 

The arts create identity and character by bringing people and neighborhoods together through a shared desire to create beautiful things. It inspires us to communicate in other ways besides words, which results in the bridging of cultures, ethnicity, religion, and age. It builds confidence, dedication and perseverance. Bryan/College Station is the perfect location to build a space that will foster this type of growth. 

Bryan/College Station, Texas is a thriving town, home to historic neighborhoods and new developments, both offering a diverse selection of retail, restaurants, art galleries and entertainment venues. It is a distinct community, rich in tradition and at the same time characterized by the globally aware, highly-educated population that makes up Texas A&M University. It is a wonderful place to live; however, this little town is missing something that I believe is vital to the exuberant spirit of its community. It is in great need of an art school and gathering place to nurture the creative hearts of the people who make up B/CS. 

Go Art Go is the solution.

Background

For the past year and a half, I have spent time running a mobile art school out of the trunk of my car, lugging around all of my art supplies to each location. Super fun, but, not always an easy thing to do! It's pretty challenging trying to stay organized and remember what to bring to each class. Having a larger, designated space will allow me to provide better instruction, more time and services to my clients.  

My classes are sought-after and book up quickly. I have been told by many residents of the area that there is a need for more unique choices in art education in BCS. There is especially a need for more options for younger children. There are not many options in the B/CS area for acquiring unique art materials. Artists of all ages need options for creative tools beyond what the corporate retailers are providing.

Go Art Go will fill this void.

Where Your Money Will Go

This is the exciting part. I have already found an AMAZING vintage Airstream trailer that has been retrofitted for an art school. It is literally READY.TO.GO. and I have been in contact with the owners about purchasing it.

Here is a sneak peak of the interior:


Isn't it AMAZING??? 

Once I get this beauty to Texas, Art class is ready to begin!

First, I need to raise money for travel expenses so I can go and get this amazing art school on wheels and bring her back to Texas! Once here, I will need to be able to support a start-up teaching staff of guest artist and educators. I will also go towards the purchase of supplies that are needed to run a proper art school, such as easels, benches, and work tables, paint, paper, canvas, pastels, markers, pencils, smocks, brushes, glue, erasers, clay, and various other items.

Here is how you can help:

If this type of project sounds like something you would be willing to support, fabulous! 

Here is how it works:

1. Click on the “Contribute Now” button. 

2. You’ll be able to enter how much you want to contribute.

3. Claim your perk. 

4. Choose how you want to pay. 

Thank You!

Want Some More information?

You can follow me on Facebook if you like. It's https://www.facebook.com/JenniferChristyArt. I'll be updating pretty regularly there about my progress. I also post images of my student's beautiful artwork every week. Check it out. It will make you happy.

Some of the rewards feature original artwork by me. If you would like to see my paintings, visit my website at JenniferChristyArt.com. 

If you'd like to learn more about my experience in art education, click on my "Full-Bio" to the right. I have years of experience that you can read about!

Still here? 

Awesome. 

Below you can read about my class offerings and client reviews.

Client reviews :

We are so fortunate to have Jennifer Christy teaching art in our community!  My three year old has attended her Toddler Art Workshops and loves them.  Jennifer has a way of keeping the little ones engaged though literature, sensory play, and art instruction using a variety of mediums and techniques.  My daughter is always excited to display her masterpieces after class.  It’s the perfect way to spend a morning with your expressive toddler. -Marnie Krajicek

My 4-year-old and 2-year-old have truly loved attending Jennifer's Toddler Art Workshops. My girls have enjoyed exploring art through literature and experiencing new artistic materials. Jennifer has a wonderful way of guiding children to discover their own inner artist. - Heidi Gratz

Felt very comfortable and non-competitive in the art and the yoga….What a beautiful combination of looking inward and then moving outward towards creativity….love, love, love this! –Sharon Holt

Class Descriptions:

Some of the classes I have been teaching for the past year include, “Toddler Art”, “Yoga and Painting”, and “Art After-School”.

Yoga and Painting Workshop: This playful heart-centered workshop, taught by Marnie Krajicek and Jennifer Christy, is for anyone interested in yoga and the arts. You will enjoy a whole new way of painting through a process of loosening up, getting inspired and allowing your art and yoga practice to expand naturally. The emphasis is on finding your inner creativity and allowing your personal expression to flourish. There is no need to know how to draw, paint, meditate or do yoga. The only requirement is an open-mind and a willingness to have fun!

Toddler Art: For toddlers, art is all about the process and getting those little hands messy! This is an exploratory class, with a different theme each week. We will explore drawing, painting, and sculpture through hands-on art production. 

Art After School: Young artists will develop their artistic skills and learn new techniques during the 12-week semester. Students will master watercolor and acrylic paints and improve their sketching skills under the instruction of art educator Jennifer Christy.

story:
Hello, my name is LaVonne Sallee’, aka The Barbie Lady

I worked in the corporate world for 44 years. My career enabled me to
raise three children, but I never attended to my true calling and passion with
my artistic talents. Who would have thought, at the age of 60, my life would
start over and turn in a whole new direction.


In 2006 I began creating Altered Barbie Art work. In 2008 when the market crashed I lost most of my retirement account and decided to leave San Francisco after living there for 52 years. I found a live and work space in downtown Vallejo California where the cost of living was much lower.  I've received a lot of very good press and had a story printed in several Bay Area newspapers and online (see:Wikipedia/LaVonneSallee) .

A film student at City College of San Francisco asked if she could create a documentary of me and my artwork (www.ooakbarbies.com) as the subject of
her term project. I agreed and the film has now been making the rounds of the
film festivals (16 so far) all over the United States. All of this publicity has been great for my Ego, but has not had a lot of impact on sales. I know that I need to advertise. I turned my van into an art car which is great for advertising but it’s not enough. At the end of the last 6 years, I have been in the red.

I needed to lower my cost of living even more and I moved to a vibrant, beautiful, peaceful town named Silverton in Oregon. Within two weeks of moving here, The Green Store downtown offered to show my work there and it is getting a lot of positive attention but advertising is still necessary. The Green Store is more of a Gift Store than a Gallery but I have realized that most of the people who purchase my work are people who purchase it as a gift for someone else.

I create products from pictures of my artwork such as Playing Cards, T-Shirts, Greeting Cards etc. These are also sold in the Green Store but they do not bring in enough money.

I wrote a book about how LaVonne Sallee’, Criminal Investigator became the Barbie Lady in the hope to create another source of income and that book in now in production.

I have been invited to New York City for the film festival in mid November where the documentary of me and my artwork will be shown. I have turned down these kinds of invitations as a result of my financial situation but could not resist this once in a life time opportunity. While a place to stay will be provided, I needed to pay for my ticket which I put on my Credit Card that has had a zero balance since 2008.Going into debt is not an option for me (now at the age of 67) and having to use my credit card after all these years has inspired me to ask for Help. I currently live on my Social
Security and a small retirement check. That is enough to cover my living expenses (rent, utilities, gas, food etc.)  but I also recognize the need to invest money into making my business a success. In order to do that I must promote myself. I want to raise money and spend it as follows:

*Advertising, Advertising, Advertising

*Cover costs of the Book (The Barbie Lady shares
her Experience, Strength and Hope) now in production.

*Build a (better) Web Site named www.thebarbielady.com

*Travel

o Film festivals where the documentary will be
showing (Spain and Amsterdam have now requested the film)

o Find other Gift Shops who will represent my work in other towns and/or states

Asking for HELP is not something that comes easy for me. I offer some of the products I make from the pictures of my art work as an incentive for your desire to HELP me.  No donation is too small.

Thank you.
story_txt: Hello, my name is LaVonne Sallee’, aka The Barbie LadyI worked in the corporate world for 44 years. My career enabled me toraise three children, but I never attended to my true calling and passion withmy artistic talents. Who would have thought, at the age of 60, my life wouldstart over and turn in a whole new direction. In 2006 I began creating Altered Barbie Art work. In 2008 when the market crashed I lost most of my retirement account and decided to leave San Francisco after living there for 52 years. I found a live and work space in downtown Vallejo California where the cost of living was much lower.  I've received a lot of very good press and had a story printed in several Bay Area newspapers and online (see:Wikipedia/LaVonneSallee) . A film student at City College of San Francisco asked if she could create a documentary of me and my artwork (www.ooakbarbies.com) as the subject ofher term project. I offer some of the products I make from the pictures of my art work as an incentive for your desire to HELP me.  No donation is too small. Thank you.

story:
Our planet provides us with a huge array of natural and beautiful materials.

This extraordinary project is a gift back in return.

You can be a part of this journey by helping me bring this cabinet to life.


                                      

                                            Original preliminary sketch


Introduction

My name is Paul Pinchefsky and I'm a furniture designer maker from Dorset England.  I work from my workshop in the heart of Dorset’s rural countryside close to the historic village of Milton Abbas. 

I completed my apprenticeship in 1984 and have since gained many years experience in the design and woodworking craft, including cabinetry, joinery and carpentry.  

During the 1990’s, I designed several non commissioned pieces, one of which (Maple Music Cabinet) was made and exhibited in Harrods,  I was also invited onto a TV programme with this cabinet by Mr John Bly – a recognised expert in antique furniture. 

I made a promise to myself that one day, I will take on the mammoth task and make the masterpiece from my design portfolio - the Tiger Oak Cabinet.  Work began on a part time basis during August 2012 and I gave myself five years to make this highly complex piece of art.  Almost two years on, I still haven't finished the prototype leg and I now fear I will never finish this extravagant piece, unless I can work on it full time for approximately 18 months.  I go to bed at night dreaming of seeing this beauty in its real state of being. 

To give you an accurate insight to the cabinet and the cabinet's presence, here's an image of scale;

                       

The Tiger Oak Cabinet measures 2.1M in height and 1.5M from claw-to-claw. The main body is cylindrical at 1M in diameter, with four revolving components; the front of the main body (the cabinet's door), the top cap and the two zebrano bands above & below the main body.  These components will revolve 180 degrees at the same time and in opposite directions at the flick of a button - revealing the cabinet's contents.   All the spheres you see in the above sketch drawing are maple; the top cap is beech painted velvet black; the legs are also beech painted velvet black, with boxwood claws;  the pedestal drop column is tiger oak with maple spheres; the main body is also tiger oak with an extraordinary cryptographic marquetry display inlaid using boxwood, ebony and stainless steel; the two bands above & below the main body are zebrano as mentioned above.   The presence of this cabinet will ooze and fill a room with its own aura of magnificence.  To have the help to enable me to bring this masterpiece into reality will be overwhelming and the journey will be filled with unbelievable experiences.


The Wood Samples

Tiger Oak - main body & pedestal dropped column

Zebrano banding - above & below main body

Beech painted velvet black - top cap & legs

Maple (quilted or curly) - all the spheres throughout the cabinet

Boxwood - all the claws & part marquetry inlay to main body

Ebony - part marquetry inlay to main body and string banding

Black Walnut - part marquetry inlay to main body

Below - Cryptographic Marquetry Inlay to wrap around front of main body.


Costing & Funding

It's very difficult to cost a unique piece of furniture like this.  The figure I'm asking for is an estimate in what I believe it will take to make this piece, using expensive exotic woods/veneers and complex engineering components.

If my campaign doesn't reach the entire goal, I can at least make a good start on the cabinet and then start another campaign for stage 2 of the project at a later date. 

Perks

I would like to offer some interesting perks to everyone who would like to support this project - including; 

  • a complete signed work-in-progress e-book showing illustrations, photographs and plenty of text
  • a DVD of the work-in-progress
  • potential woodworking classes
  • a complete signed work-in-progress e-book showing illustrations, photographs and plenty of text, a DVD of the work-in-progress delivered in a hand made box, and potential woodworking classes.

I would also like to include everyone's name who helped me to make this cabinet in a document folder which will be passed on with the cabinet to the new owner. 

Is this project a worthy cause?

I know this project isn't going to change the world or help the desperate people who need aid and medicine.  But it will bring joy and inspiration to people who see it, stand next to it, touch it and hopefully, feel inspired by its presence.     

For me, this project isn't about making a piece of furniture with the intention of selling it to make a profit - it's about bringing a piece of art into reality.  The Earth has given us a wealth of beautiful woods and this project is a gift back to our Earth as a token of appreciation for all kinds of people to enjoy and feel inspired. 

Please spread the word around about this unique and very bespoke piece of furniture.  The inspiration is that 99.99% of everything we see in our world on a daily basis, comes from our planet Earth.  Simple, but truly inspirational. 

Thank you for your time and I hope you enjoy this campaign and seeing this work become a reality. 

PS: There are also a couple of work examples with a film in the Gallery page.

Any questions about the cabinet and its features will be gratefully answered.

A huge Thank You in advance!

story:
KITTYZENS OF BLACK ROCK CITY!

The Magic Lantern Society presents Chairman Meow, an enigmatic secret project for Burning Man 2016.

So what IS Chairman Meow exactly?

A secret society? An elaborate game? A hidden theme camp? Or maybe* ALL OF THE ABOVE?

If we told you, then we’d have to kill you—because that would ruin the best part which is the surprise. What we CAN say is that it’s wildly experimental, highly participatory, and surprisingly elaborate. If you like fun and have a sense of mischief, we’re inviting you to dive off into a curious unknown.  
 

SUPPORT THE REVOLUTION!

Help bring Chairman Meow to the playa by joining the Commeownist Party! Your egalitarian enlistment dues help fund the creation of Commeownist supplies and rations for kittyzens across Black Rock City.

While there will be ways to join the Commeownist Party on playa, enlisting on IndieGoGo will reward you with surprises, intrigue, and an official Commeownist uniform—including, but not limited to, an awesome Chairman Meow hat! 
 

WHO WE ARE

The Commeownist Party Central Committee was founded by the members of the The Magic Lantern Society (of EBB & Glow village), a theme camp dedicated to fostering playa magic through radical participation.

Over the years, our members have been deeply involved with (and creating swag for) projects such as Temple of Promise, The Alien Siege Machine, Eternal Return, Anubis, and Project Flashlight.

*Probably?

story:
Hey y'all!  This newest internet begging is to hopefully get my next album recorded, among other things.  I had such a great time recording the first one, and luckily received a little help from another crowd funding source otherwise I wouldn't have been able to do it.  And now look, I've got a really great first album because of it (If you haven't checked it out yet, please do.  It's called Sad Songs & Switchblades)!

And if ya liked that one, you're gonna LOVE my next album.  I will definitely put more songs on this new one also.  But yeah, pretty much I really need this next album and videos and merch and all this stuff that costs money that I don't have.  Doesn't it sound silly to let some ugly, green paper tell you that you can't fulfill your wants and dreams??  It is, that's why I'm not above asking for help.  If you can help, I am beyond grateful.  If you can't help, I totally understand and don't expect you to (you could share the hell out of this video though.  That's free!!).  And if you're one of my haters and you're just here checking out how lame my plea is, that's fine too.  I ain't mad at you.  You could probably find another musician that you respect and care about what they have to say or create and support them though.   There is plenty of good (and even of money) in this world.  Spread the love!!  And thank you in advance.  You're a damn angel and whatever you put out, comes back tenfold <3

story:
Short Summary

I have created a new series of Prints and Apparel constructing the Perpetual Propaganda Collection.  The essence of the collection draws influence from propaganda, photography and global symbols.

My mission is to level the global market by platforming individuals to an equal echelon.  Creating a new standard for humanity based in progression, rooted in culture, shaped by art, and balanced by technology.  The aim is to teach others to embrace a variety of perspectives and perceptions while simultaneously destroying hate.

In modern times we exist in a globalizing market with increasing collaboration between nations.   The world is becoming more transparent exposing our similarities as people while our differences remain beautiful and unique.  As a result of globalization borders dividing different cultures continue to fade and diminish.  This concept is evident in an increase in trade volume between countries in context of goods and products.  

By circulating goods and products throughout the world consequently culture and ideology are also distributed.  This has been made possible by the internet and social media applications.  By combining the internet’s reach with a social initiative the web has evolved into a cultural hub.  Little over 3 billion people (almost half the world population) have access to the internet allowing them to constantly share information.  More specifically individuals are sharing culture.  

Culture in the context of this global analysis can be defined as language, art, literature, religion, music, apparel and food.   The effect this has had is present in humanity’s desire to know more about each other.  This thirst for understanding is only quenchable through cultural experience. 

Using art I hope to communicate this observation of the world through a dynamic set of mediums including graphic art, silkscreened prints and video. The goal is to produce art that will inspire further destruction of the walls that divide us.

What We Need & What You Get

Any and all contributions made by my supporters are crucial to the success of this campaign.  Contributing to my campaign creates opportunities for this project that would not be possible without your funding. 

The Perpetual Propaganda Budget (Month Long Event): $6,000:
  • Venue -$250
  • Set Up - $100
  • Art Supplies - $800
  • Apparel x Merchandise - $1800
  • DJ x Music - $700
  • Promotion x Marketing - $350
  • Equipment - $2000
Providing donations toward this project come with a variety of perks for those who contribute funds.  The more notable perks for donations include the following:
  •  $25 OFFERING PERK PACKAGE - Receive 1 Free Sticker and an Assortment of Wearable Pins.
  • $50 PLEDGE PERK PACKAGE - Receive 3 Free Stickers and an Assortment of Wearable Pins.
  • $100 INVESTOR PERK PACKAGE - Receive 3 Free Stickers, an Assortment of Wearable Pins, and 1 Free Print.
  • $300 SPONSOR PERK PACKAGE -  Grants an individual or a company the right to have their  Logo included in all promotional material (Physical Flyers and Promotional Cards).  In addition you will receive 3 Free Stickers, an Assortment of Wearable Pins and 3 Free Prints.

Making a donation to this campaign demonstrates an immense public support for my art and words do not adequately describe my level of appreciation. 

Project Description

The debut will begin with a Gallery Exhibition of The Perpetual Propaganda Collection.  The exhibition will be held Friday June 3rd.  The Collection will feature 20 original pieces created specifically for the show.  The exhibition will open 4pm and close at 10pm. 

The second installment of the Perpetual Propaganda Collection will be executed Friday June 10th in the form of a Pop-Up Shop called Fertile Grounds.  The shop is intended to simulate the global market in an interactive experience.  The store front will feature five local brands selling merchandise.  The Pop-Up Shop will open at 4pm and close at 10pm. 

The final installment of the Perpetual Propaganda Collection will conclude with a meet and greet Friday June 17th, 2016.  The meet and greet will serve as a mixer for local artist, supporters, contributors, and business owners.  The meet and greet will start at 10pm and end at 2am. 

DJ’s will be present at each event providing music that will enhance the atmosphere and energy of the event.  All events will take place at Boom Concepts located at 5145 Penn Ave, Pittsburgh, PA 15224.

The Impact

Reaching the fund raising goal will have a tremendous effect on my artistic development.  Reaching the goal of $6,000 will allow me to execute and expand on several projects that are waiting to be initiated.  Specifically I have hopes of pursuing a public arts project involving wheat pasting original art in the Greater Pittsburgh Area. In addition receiving these funds will allow me to platform my apparel production.  I would gain the monetary resources needed to begin a regular production cycle.  Ultimately I would use this asset to further my artistic development and push toward my potential.

story:
Short Summary

I'm a visual artist and watercolourist that was selected by the Starry Night ART Exposure team from USA and the Curci Gallery in Italy chose my art to appear at the prestigious Venice Biennale – a once in a lifetime opportunity that I am very excited about!

I'm a Deaf artist from South Australia and I have been painting for most of my life but for the main part, 16 years and more with watercolour the last eight years.

I paint many themes that people feel an emotional connection to, such as my recent ‘Blue Ghosts’ works, which embodies hauntingly beautiful paintings of abandoned places with ghosts that tell their heyday stories.

The Exposure team felt a deep connection to the ‘Blue Ghosts’ in particular, and I was the first selection to appear in the Venice Biennale which is a great honour!

These artworks are the ones going into the Venice Biennale, to be displayed in the Ca Zanardi Palace at the Curci gallery!



I am raising funds to pay for the cost of exhibiting at the Biennale ($5000!), airfares and accommodation (it would be a dream come true to be there to represent my artworks and see them in the exhibition, and to network for the possibility of future exhibitions throughout Europe!). 

I have been working towards this goal for the past decade and it is FINALLY HAPPENING!  I have close connections with Italy, my roots are in the country, so it feels so fitting for my artworks (and me!) to be there!

What We Need & What You Get

I need at least $2000 to contribute to the Biennale fees, $1000 for airfares, $500 for accommodation for the nine days I will be in Venice. Plus $500 for the rewards to all pledgers.

By contributing to this crowdfunding for my Venice exhibition, you are largely helping me achieve my long-held goal to exhibit internationally.

Each of you who contributes will get a reward from the tier pledge you pick on the right side column. Not only this, you are becoming a part of my dream coming true and you get to own a piece of my art, whether that be through a postcard of my art (the general range of artworks available in my gallery or the Venice specific set), limited edition print, zine of my artworks/Italy-Venice travels, a colouring book of my line artworks or an original piece!

NOTE: it seems indiegogo refuses to accept credit cards for Australia! So it only takes Paypal, so we can only accept by paypal. If you prefer not to use paypal, let me know and I will take bank deposits directly and will put your orders through my chelle's behalfs account!

One of the colouring books line artworks from my collection of artworks


By the way, the main featured image of the Snail (me) and the doggy on the Venice Canal is up for grabs for one lucky pledger! (and it will be matt mounted! Framed too if you choose)

If I don't reach my entire goal, I will use what was raised for the fees specifically and a portion of it for the rewards (my supporters - you, are the most important and essential part of my arts and growth in my career, remember!) :)

    The Impact

    My project is valuable to the contributors (you), because you are investing in the future of my artistic career. As it is, some of my artworks sold in 2005 for $500 to $2500 are now worth between $10k and 15k I have been told!

    This was reassuring, knowing my art is worth investing in, as I put my heart and joy into my creations, each of my artwork is my babies and when each piece is born (completed), and they get sold I'm always delighted as I know they go to good homes.

    By my ‘Blue Ghosts’ artworks going to Venice and being seen by people converging from around the world, the profile of my art will be raised significantly.  

    I'm hoping that at least one of my artworks will sell at the Venice Biennale, but more so the exposure will be enough so I am recognised for my artistic career.

    I’m happy to share this particular journey with all of you who have supported me the whole way and continue to support me.  Through this crowdfund you will get to see the journey through updates, photos and the zine.

    I recently had a successful crowdfund on Kickstarter for ‘Roam the Blue Ghosts’ in January this year.  It was widely well received and now we are seeing four of these Blue Ghosts going to Venice!

      Risks & Challenges

      The risks are minimal, but more that if I don't reach my goal, I will only be able to pay part of the fees, airfares, and accommodation. Either way, we will make this happen!

        Other Ways You Can Help

        You can share this project out on facebook, twitter, linked in, and other media platforms and even through email.

        If you are not comfortable using indiegogo to make a contribution, I am offering paypal directly or bank deposits.

story:
The World Bodypainting Festival 2016 

      

    Another year has past since the last great pilgrimage to Austria to attend and compete at the WBF. A place where Artists from all across the globe and all walks of life converge to share their imagination.  For the last two years we have traveled as a team to compete and to learn from other amazing artists. This year is no different.  If you are familiar with our campaigns you know these trips are no stranger to adventure and usually ends with a great story.Our previous journeys have included lost passports, hidden music festivals, being stranded atop of a mountain, and going out to represent the Festival on a boat!  Each competition holds the keys to a new exciting tale of excitement and adventure . Most importantly this campaign helps an artist further themselves both in skill and knowledge. That artist is me…. Rudy Zanzibar Campos. 


 2015 was an exciting year for me! I had the opportunity to be on the smash hit show "SKIN WARS" 

"Skin Wars" Season 2 

Skins Wars was an amazing experience! Surrounded by body painters of all walks of life and skill levels was awe inspiring. I took away a great deal knowledge in new skills from the short time that I was on the show. I was of course saddened when it was time for me leave my Skin Wars family but from my loss I challenged myself to become better at Camouflage body paint. 

 

JW Marriott 2016 Blended Beauty 

The World Bodypainting Festival 2015 was another great event! That summer I had there privilege to teach again at the WB Academy . As well as take a class or two from other  super talented instructors. That trip was the best yet and opened the door for me to represent the WBF in Korea.


 Getting to go to South Korea was absolutely wonderful! I was able to to teach students of another culture. In the process I they taught me how to teach in a different part of the world. I was also honored to represent The WB Production and the US in working with the United Nations in South Korea. Along with other painters we provided body art installations to the Korean War Memorial Building in Seoul.







Its 2016 now and the festival is right around the corner, preparations are half way done to being compete. This year our team was going to fund the whole trip ourselves without the help of sponors. Due to one or two bumps in the road of life we have been set back slightly on our goal. I am a full time artist and blessed to be that. Everything I do goes back into my art and into my cost of living such as bills. It is with the support of sponors and art lovers that we can turn this trip into reality.   I am asking  the assistance of patrons, fans , and friends  to achieve the goal of getting to the World Bodypainting Festival. 



  What Your Team Needs     

The team has 70% of the trip in the bag! Awesome! What we have already achieved is our Airfare to Austria, Supplies to complete look of the competition piece, and Our room and board at the festival.  

   What we are needing help with and where the funds will be going are towards

   ~ Hostel stay for a group from Vienna to Portschach 

   ~ Train Fare to the Festival 

   ~ Baggage/Shipping fees

   ~ Incidentals while traveling

       ~ Perks for Indiegogo campaign 

   ~ Indiegogo and Paypal Service Fees 


Meet the Team!

 Rudy Zanzibar Campos                 Madeline Kiley 



My success is through the generosity of others.

 The impact your sponsorship has brought and will bring is more than you can possibly imagine. It is because of you that I am able to be the artist I am today and will become in the future. Being able to make this trip and network with artists and art lovers from all over the globe has opened a multitude of doors that I never existed when I first started painting. Every thread in the fabric of my life has lead to new things. One thread helped me learn a new skill, one thread got me on television, one thread allowed me to represent the WBF for the United Nations.  Each sponsor is a thread and together you are helping me weave the path of my life. 



   Every road has its risks! Caution ahead!

      As with any competition there is risk involved. Getting there is only a part of the challenge. Last year I learned a lot about my self as a person when I came placed last in my category.  Sometimes that happens. It was quite a blow from being placed 6th  the previous year to dead last. Yet we held our heads high and continued to paint on the second day not just for ourselves but for the people who helped us get to Austria. We presented or piece through out the festival. We made new friends and fans because of our piece. Even though we did not place where we wanted to fate opened other doors for us.  You sponsorship isn't a guarantee that we'll walk away with a gold medal but a promise that we'll take our art and imagination to be seen.

                Help us spread the word. 

Monetary contributions are not the only ways to help Team Rcc!  Help spread the word on your Facebook, Instagram, or Snapchat!  We have less than 20 days to get ready and your team needs you. Have an extra hour or two you can spare in the workshop? We'll take it!  

 We are also collecting some tools if you have a spare to donate.  If you have any of this stuff laying around taking space. Before you throw it out give us a call! 

~ Xacto handles 

~ Plastic Cups or mixing bowls 

~ Eva foam 

~ Sharpies 

~ Compass cutters

story:
UE countries have FREE SHIPPING included in these prices on the right >> 
Should you have questions ask us on Facebook or at indiegogo@thefeathers.ink 






Signature Navigator - hard copy
You’ll fall in love with this navigator because it’s so much more than a planner: it’s your coach, listener and motivator. All under one cover.

The signature navigator is a handcrafted leather bound refillable piece of art that you can use from morning to evening, at work, in meetings, in coaching, or at home.

The satin ivory paper, the strong binder system, the black color theme and the functional design and inserts will make the usage of the navigator a powerful experience you’ll love.

After this campaign, the future retail prices will start at $77 plus shipping.



Type in PDF (3-month dated planner) is designed for coaches to include it in their coaching programs and monitor the clients’ progress.
Note: This is not an app, it is a PDF that has fillable fields where you can include your information.

Scroll down to see the images and get a feel of the inner design and function. We have included all sections for Business, Personal and Architect editions:





We trust that you’ll love this friendly, easy-to-use navigator that will help you stay on track every single day. So we’re saving a piece for you: 3-MONTH PLANNER free to anyone who shares this project on social media! Get free access to this beautiful and functional design at the end of the campaign, just by sending a note with a screenshot or link to your social share to freePDF@thefeathers.ink

To share, go on top of the page, and click on the social buttons on the left side.
Note: this is a dated 90-day planner PDF version, starting with September 2016.






We will receive the raised funds in 3 week after the campaign is completed, and we will immediately start the production. The bulk production can last up to 40 days, so we estimate to start shipping in July.







The navigator is a state-of-art product that will help us give chaos a break and stay focused on OURSELVES every single day. Over the last 9 months, we have given our full attention both to the inside and outside of the product (I - Raluca - am an architect and a true Virgo... so yes, I am obsessed with details) and we trust this could change lives.  

In order to cut costs and make this accessible to more brave people around the world, we need to build in bulk. That’s why we need your help, and we are here, on indiegogo.

Here’s a short description of the features that will justify the production costs.




Even though this is our first crowdfunding project, we have high hopes that we will raise enough money to enables us donate up to 70 navigators to young entrepreneurs. We are our own bosses for quite some time now, and we have relentlessly encouraged young students to start on their own, own their time and decisions.

We want to use the navigators to enable young talents to organize and launch new ideas. And that’s where you come in: our very first pledge is special created to raise funds for our donations. With just 3$ you'll going to join our cause, and you will also receive the printable PDF version of the Navigator. Thank you for being with us!

Our plans for the future are big and include:

  • Creating the navigator’s app
  • Creating a Mindset Shifting Program for: entrepreneurs, young people and their parents, employees and their employers
  • and probably much more (we will let the Universe have a say in it)





Raluca Comanescu is a Romanian Architect and Designer, who takes time very seriously. After 4 years as junior architect, 5 years working as a branding expert, and 2 years invested in a failed millions dollars idea, she decided it’s about the time to do a change: so she unfolded the navigator's idea.

For every dream, there is a fabricator. Alex is a Romanian architect and Raluca’s life partner. He started to get involved into the project a few months after the project had begun, and he was in charged with the fabrication of the navigators.

The prototypes you've seen in the video, or pictures were entirely designed and crafted by us. For the final products development we have around 6 different suppliers (for custom leather, paper, features, and more) with who we'll collaborate to turn this dream to reality.

During the development we have been supported by great professionals who’ve embraced our project as if their own. We thank you to all.



Risks & Challenges

Let's talk about risks, based on the type of product you want:

1. If you're a coach and you're interested in the FILLABLE PDF version, please notice that we have the strongest desire to deliver this version to you. However, creating a fillable PDF of this kind take a lot of time (around 100 hours), so we will only create this version if, at least 20 orders will be placed. It means that if we have less than 20 orders, we will have to give up on this version, and refund you the payed money. However if more than 20 orders will be placed, you will get the fillable PDF! All we need from you is to tell us when you want the calendar to start.

2. The leather bound refillable Navigator is coming with its risks as well: manufacturing and shipping. However, over the last months we have been working on getting the best possible prices and most quality shipping possible. To keep the production under control, and also to save on manufacturing costs, we have decided to do the assembling ourselves, and to only outsource the essential parts of the navigators like:

  • the leather cover will be custom made
  • the cover will be cut to shape in a small factory
  • the features will be custom made and delivered to us
Challenges usually may come up in the production process, however as architects we are always ready for it. We aim to have the navigators shipped to you in July, or in worse case scenario by August, just in time for you to plan on it starting with September.

This is the very first public version of the navigators, and even though we did everything in our power to be the perfect book ever, we might have missed some details. So please drop me an email any time you feel there is something unclear about using the navigator or, if you want something more out of it. Our plan is to design even better versions of it, over the next 3 years, so your feedback will be highly appreciated.

We are decided to being transparent during this whole campaign, and long after it. So keep an eye on our updates field, because we will let you know how the process goes. Let's create an amazing product that you will love for years to come.


FAQs

> What is a V.I.P. Shipping?

We are working with an awesome  fulfillment company (www.altexpress.ro) to get the best prices for the best quality shipping. Therefore we will use a door to door delivery system to enable a smooth experience, and prevent delays. In addition all packages come with a tracking code, that you will receive once the package was shipped your way.

We have enabled the "FREE SHIPPING in UE" option. Moreover, since this is an European friendly project, our European backers will not pay customs taxes when they receive the package (which usually raise up to 50$). Enjoy it, my European friends!

> How do you know where to ship the package?

Since this is our first campaign, we believe that we will use the same address you've introduced when you ordered a navigator. We might however send you an email in July to get your updated shipping information, and VAT code (if available). We will keep you up to date as we progress.


> Does the Navigator include a 6-month or a 12-month dated planner?
The planner inside the navigator is to be used for 6 months, starting in September. This allows us enough room to add various notes and extensions, without making the navigator a heavy product to carry with you.

Before you finish the planner, we will remind you about the possibility to get new refills (which btw are almost half the price of the first navigator). You can also email us at indiegogo@thefeathers.ink if you'll like more refills, earlier then planned.

> I am a distributor, can I get more than 10 Navigators to re-sell?

Definitely. Send us a note at indiegogo@thefeathers.ink and we can discuss more about what you need. We are also open to do some brand customization on these navigators.

2. The leather bound refillable Navigator is coming with its risks as well: manufacturing and shipping. However, over the last months we have been working on getting the best possible prices and most quality shipping possible. To keep the production under control, and also to save on manufacturing costs, we have decided to do the assembling ourselves, and to only outsource the essential parts of the navigators like:

the leather cover will be custom made
the cover will be cut to shape in a small factory

the features will be custom made and delivered to us

Challenges usually may come up in the production process, however as architects we are always ready for it. We aim to have the navigators shipped to you in July, or in worse case scenario by August, just in time for you to plan on it starting with September. This is the very first public version of the navigators, and even though we did everything in our power to be the perfect book ever, we might have missed some details. So please drop me an email any time you feel there is something unclear about using the navigator or, if you want something more out of it. Our plan is to design even better versions of it, over the next 3 years, so your feedback will be highly appreciated.We are decided to being transparent during this whole campaign, and long after it. So keep an eye on our updates field, because we will let you know how the process goes. Let's create an amazing product that you will love for years to come.
FAQs> What is a V.I.P. Shipping?We are working with an awesome  fulfillment company (www.altexpress.ro) to get the best prices for the best quality shipping. Therefore we will use a door to door delivery system to enable a smooth experience, and prevent delays. In addition all packages come with a tracking code, that you will receive once the package was shipped your way.We have enabled the "FREE SHIPPING in UE" option. Moreover, since this is an European friendly project, our European backers will not pay customs taxes when they receive the package (which usually raise up to 50$). Enjoy it, my European friends!> How do you know where to ship the package?Since this is our first campaign, we believe that we will use the same address you've introduced when you ordered a navigator. We might however send you an email in July to get your updated shipping information, and VAT code (if available). We will keep you up to date as we progress.> Does the Navigator include a 6-month or a 12-month dated planner?The planner inside the navigator is to be used for 6 months, starting in September. This allows us enough room to add various notes and extensions, without making the navigator a heavy product to carry with you. Before you finish the planner, we will remind you about the possibility to get new refills (which btw are almost half the price of the first navigator). You can also email us at indiegogo@thefeathers.ink if you'll like more refills, earlier then planned.> I am a distributor, can I get more than 10 Navigators to re-sell?Definitely. Send us a note at indiegogo@thefeathers.ink and we can discuss more about what you need. We are also open to do some brand customization on these navigators.

story:
Our Story

The Shahan Natalie Family Foundation, Inc. (SNFF), a California-based non-profit 501(c)(3) organization is embarking upon a new program of cultural outreach. The objective of the program is to introduce the treasures of Armenia to the world by bringing artists, experts, scholars, scientists and other professionals to the United States to share their knowledge with the Armenian and non-Armenian communities. The lectures they present will be recorded and made available on DVD and also via the Internet in order to reach local, national, and international audiences.

The first program that SNFF is committed to implement is the international presentation of “Komitas: the Life and Works,” a multimedia DVD, comprising of a digitized collection of songs, photographs, texts and videos related to Komitas. The multimedia DVD will be presented by Garegin Chugaszyan, co-founder and president  of ITE CJSC, specializing in the development of multimedia products for education in Yerevan,  Armenia. One of the products of the company, “Aram Khachaturian: The Life and Works” has been selected by the World Summit Award 2005 Grand Jury as the world’s best cultural CD/DVD multimedia product of 2005.  “Armenian Genocide of 1915-1923,” another interactive multimedia DVD, received recognition by the World Summit Award 2005 Grand Jury as one of the top 10 products in e-learning category and was given special mention. Both products were winner in the All-Armenian 2005 National e-content contest “Mashtots 1600.”

 

The Impact

Our goal is to present the cultural treasures of the Armenian people to the world. We believe this will reflect a positive image of Armenian values and outstanding achievements, which have earned the nation international respect and admiration. We hope that programs such as this will also act as a powerful counterbalance to a negative stereotype of the Armenian people, which has been mushrooming through the news media lately. The presentations will be recorded and made available on DVD and online.


What We Need & What You Get

In order to bring Garegin Chugaszyan to the U.S. for the inaugural outreach program, “Komitas: The Life and Works,” we need your financial support. Be it $1 or $1,000, your tax-deductible contribution will help to fly Mr. Chugaszyan to the U.S. from Armenia and provide housing, meals, a modest stipend, travel expenses inside the U.S., and the cost of advertising (newspaper, television, and other news media). We are offering a few great promotional gifts as a thank you for your donations. For a donation in the amount between $100 and $249, we will give you a copy of “Aram Khachaturian: The Life and Works” multimedia CD-ROM; a donation ranging between $250 and $499 will reward you with two multimedia DVDs: a copy of “Armenian Genocide of 1915-1923” and “Aram Khachaturian: The Life and Works” multimedia  CD-ROMs. A donation of $500 and more will be thanked with three multimedia DVDs: a copy of “Paruir Sevak. These are my words…”, “Aram Khachaturian: The Life and Works” and “Armenian Genocide of 1915-1923” multimedia  CD-ROM s. Regardless of the donated amount, your name will be listed on our sponsor page at www.snff.org, unless anonymity is requested.

The project will have two phases. The first visit will be at the end of April, beginning of May when Garegin Chugaszyan will speak at colleges and universities in California and Massachusetts, including: USC, UCLA, Cal State Northridge, Glendale Community College, Fresno State University, UC Berkeley, Stanford, Harvard, MIT. The visits will take place during regular academic sessions, to reach as many students as possible.

The second phase of the program will take place near the end of May, beginning of June  and will be focused on the public at large in Los Angeles, Glendale and the surrounding areas; Fresno, Silicon Valley, San Francisco. Event venues may include: Los Angeles, Glendale and Pasadena Public Libraries; and Ararat-Eskijian Museum. Publicity will include television interviews, newspaper articles, flyer distribution through local community organizations and business channels.

The funds exceeding the goal set for this project will be directed to the next outreach program organized by the SNFF.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word by involving your colleagues, friends, family, as well as your online social network, and encouraging them to contribute to and support this inaugural Armenian outreach effort. Let’s bring out the best in us!
