story:
Welcome to the Neuro Bureau's art@hbm campaign..

The Neurobureau is a nonprofit organization that fosters collaboration in neuroscience.  The Bureau hosts a number of events and projects to facilitate the sharing of tools, data and ideas within and beyond the neuroscientific community.  If you haven't met us before, please visit our website to learn more: www.neurobureau.org

This campaign focuses on raising money to support the art@HBM exhibition at the Organization for Human Brain Mapping annual meeting, which this year, is taking place in Hamburg, Germany, June 8th-12th.  This is the fourth year we will be organizing art@hbm.  We believe that unforeseen and amazing things can happen when collaboration occurs, and that pushing the interface between art and science presents a valuable opportunity for us as a  neuroscience community.  And we just like art..and science...together.

What We Need

Our goal is to raise $10 000 US.  These funds help us to:

  • transport the art to and from the exhibit
  • pay for materials and supplies for installation and display
  • administer the Brain Art exhibition
  • start getting ready for next year (this one is so important!)

What you Get

The art@HBM occupies a special place at the OHBM conference.  We come to the conference from around the world, and getting more than great science out of the experience seems fitting.  Donating to the campaign is a way to participate, and to be part of this as a community.  It also helps us know that people still want art@hbm to happen.  And if all that weren't enough, each donation level earns a specially designed perk.  Our plan is to grow these perks into collections over the years, so don't miss out on these inaugural limited-edition offerings...  See Gallery for images of perks and the art featured in the perks.

This year's show is titled "Sidewise in Time" and is curated by Berlin-based art historian, Elena Agudio.  The exhibit considers the concept of time and its perception.  Reflecting the modern elements of the art scene in Germany, the exhibit will feature multimedia installations and performance pieces, as well as a number of collaborations between artists and scientists.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell others!  You never know who might be dying to have a diffusion brain t-shirt and would love to help us out.

story:
"Hope" by Ron Warford. All rights reserved.

About Ron Warford and the campaign

Ron Warford is a self-described starving artist. No, really, watch that video up there. He says it himself. He's really good at the art bit, so we'd like to get a show going, and help him stop starving, as it were.


"Strength" by Ron Warford.
All rights reserved.
Ron's been drawing since he was seven, and has been featured in many galleries and museums over the decades, including the Smithsonian and Guggenheim, as well as locally at the Everson Museum.
 

The current campaign will fund a show at CNY Artists, a gallery featuring Central New York-based artists that is located near the food court in Shoppingtown Mall. The gallery is curated by Peter Svoboda, who will curate the show, as well.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to put the show together, Ron needs the supplies and stability to work full-time. He works in pencil – primarily black or white graphite, but with some color on occasion – and he'll need drawing paper.

He will need the stability of covering his housing, food and utility bills to work full-time through the summer to have the show in autumn. Your support will also provide for promotional materials and a formal launch of the show.

» More: Steve Nyland interviews Ron Warford

The perks for this campaign are amazing: In exchange for investing in Ron's art, you get some. We do have a couple of originals available to some donors – these are amazing, framed works of art that will appreciate in value for generations – and also prints of Ron's amazing work at very affordable levels. Most prints are done with archival ink on archival paper, and will last for a very long time; they won't fade like that print of Munch's "The Scream" you bought your freshman year at college.


"Michael" by Ron Warford.
All rights reserved.
You'll notice this is a flexible funding campaign; we will put this show on. You will be able to come to CNY Artists in the fall to see Ron's work. Without some of the funding, there may not be a formal launch or announcement, and to really let Ron create new work, he needs to not worry about whether he can keep a roof over his family's head – we'd really like to see a bunch of new stuff on the walls for his show.
 

More Ways to Help Out

We understand that some of you would like to help out but can't contribute money. Help us get the word out! Ask your friends and family to contribute. If you know of a restaurant or cafe or other business that might want to hang some of Ron's art – even a print that they frame themselves – tell them where they can get a 13"x17" original drawing of a young Michael Jackson (above left) for only $40, or one of our other items perks.

Perks

Here are some of the other items we're offering as perks:


"Jazz" by Ron Warford. All rights reserved.


"Old Man" by Ron Warford.
All rights reserved.

"We Pray" by Ron Warford.
All rights reserved.
 


"Eyes – I See You" by Ron Warford. All rights reserved.

story:
Hi, and thank you for taking the time to look at my campaign.

My name is William (Billy to my friends) and I have always dreamed of making a second income from art, but I have yet to push the art that I do to that next level. Hope rose up when a friend gave me a copy of “Drawing on the Right Side of the Brain.” Reading through and following the exercises improved my work and I saw potential in my work that it might move forward with some direct instruction. Unfortunately, all the “Drawing on the Right Side of the Brain” workshops were too far away, until now!  The workshop has finally come to Austin. 

The “Drawing on the Right Side of the Brain workshop” is a five day intensive drawing class.This class has proven that the global skill of drawing any perceived object, person, or place requires five basic component perceptual skills. These skills are the perception of edges, spaces, relationships, lights and shadows, and the whole or gestalt. Like other global or whole skills, such as reading and driving where each skill is learned and merged with the others until you are simply preforming the act, Drawing can be taught the same way.

Classes are held for 5 consecutive days for 8 hours each day from May 15th to May 19th

--Day One starts with a lecture on the principles of brain hemisphere management, followed by students copying a Picasso drawing upside-down. This exercise gives the brain a task that the left hemisphere will turn down and the drawings will therefore be perceptual rather than symbolic. Drawing on the Right Side of the Brain is all about turning off the left hemisphere or giving the brain a task that the left hemisphere cannot do therefore allowing the right perceptual side of the brain to take over. Later in the day we experiment with blind contour drawings to enable us to slow down our vision and tap into the right hemisphere.

--Day Two starts with a lecture discussing the use of the picture plane followed by a detailed drawing of our hand. This exercise, with the use of the flattened picture plane, teaches students to draw a three dimensional subject on a two dimensional surface. In the afternoon, a lecture on negative space followed by a drawing of a chair done strictly in negative space, teaches the right brain to look at the spaces between objects to render the drawing rather than drawing the lines of the object.


--Day Three starts with a lecture on the skill of sighting followed by a drawing of a room corner or, weather permitting a drawing outside. This learning is also called perspective and proportion. The skill of sighting is crucial to observation because every drawing is about the relationships between objects, angles and shapes.


--Day Four begins with a lecture on the proportions of the head in profile, followed by a drawing of a fellow student in profile. The key learning for this day is turning off the verbal left hemisphere and its desire to make symbolic associations. One student draws for 20 minutes while another poses and visa versa for the afternoon.


--Day Five starts with a discussion of light logic, also known as light and shadow. We learn a shading technique called cross hatching and the value scale of light to dark, which allows for the rendering of dramatic light and shadow within a drawing. We examine the proportions of the full faced head in preparation for the days drawing. Using grounded paper, all the perceptual skills we have learnt so far, and by looking for the shapes of the lights and shadow (negative space), students learn to use their eraser as a drawing tool together with the pencil.

What We Need

This 5 day workshop is $1,600 supplies included.

All funding over the goal amount will go to furthering artistic endeavors in the form of professional supplies vs. hobby store supplies and other classes.

Funding that does not reach the goal will likewise go to furthering artistic endeavors.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute it would be a great help if you could get the word out about what this campaign is trying to do. Just telling a friend or linking to it on facebook could be all we need to reach our goal.

story:
REMEMBERING TAFT:

For many of us, 2115 Taft felt like home.  It was a place of community, healing and love.  And so it's no surprise that many of us within the community at large have experienced a great deal of pain in regard to the loss of Taft.

But as someone who was actively and intimately involved in the Taft community through Make Art or Die, Love Machine, Iwo Jima, Gospel Brunch, and Ecclesia, it is my opinion that although it's hard to see the building go, the heart of what made Taft special was actually the people- you and me! 

I've heard some say that Elder doesn't feel like Taft.  Well, honestly it doesn't.  It feels like Elder.  There will never be another Taft- nowhere else will ever feel like Taft!  It was unique and special and we should count ourselves lucky to have experienced such a sacred space.  But what I don't want us to lose as a community at large is that although we will never replace 2115 Taft, it is within our grasp and calling to co-generate a new space- a space ripe for new memories, new healing and new life. 

What I am suggesting is that we hold the keys for making Elder a uniquely special place of community, healing and love that we can all call home.

"Because to think that what made 2115 Taft special can in some way be torn down and lost forever is to never have known the Source of what made Taft so special in the first place."

THE PROJECT:

When I found out that Taft was being sold I felt drawn to pick up a camera and capture some of the sights and textures of Taft from my point of view.  I didn't know why- I just felt like I had to do it.

With the permission of the Taft community, I captured essential snapshots of our sacred space.  Many of the images depict feet and floors- partly to avoid exploiting faces/identities within the sacred space of gatherings, but also because feet and floors are a lot of what one sees while staring contemplatively during the conversations of healing, hope and love that took place there!

The imagery in this show reflects my personal perspective of Taft- the things that I took note of and that where special to me.  I hope that when others from the community see this show, they will be transported back to a time and place not so long ago, and would somehow be reminded and put in touch with the spirit of 2115 Taft that I believe is still very much alive and well, here and now.

My vision for this collection is to bring this spirit of Taft into the hallways of Elder.  To have this collection symbolically wrapped around the entire building, embracing our community at Elder.

The premise of this show attempts to capture snapshots of Taft's visual essence, transplanting them into the heart of Elder- hence the name of the collection is "TRANSPLANT".  This collection consists of twenty over-sized canvases, each a whopping 64"x36".

I have been working with staff at Ecclesia to put this show together for several weeks.  When I pitched the unsolicited idea to have a show that honors and transplants the spirit of Taft into the halls of Elder, I was met with excitement, warmth and support from staff.  I feel very honored by their openness and welcoming spirit to remember Taft and the shared community experienced there.

View the collection now via the gallery tab above or clicking here.

WHERE YOU COME IN:

I cannot do this alone.  I need your help to make this happen.  When I submitted my proposal for this collection I told Carson that I would like to raise the funds for this collection through the community. 

This is a huge undertaking from a production standpoint.  For those familiar with my REHUMANIZE collection, this show has 2.5x more pieces, and the individual canvases are 3x bigger!

In order to make this collection come to life, we need $2,900 to cover the hard costs associated with printing and stretching 20 canvases, creating wall graphics and producing print outs for the collection.  This number also reflects a $3,200 discount I have negotiated off of the total printing cost!

I really want to see this project come to life in our community and so I am fully prepared and planning to do my part for free- but I need to at least raise the base amount of $2,900 to make it happen.  Should we raise more than $2,900, I will be gratefully accepting any surplus as an honorarium going towards my personal involvement on this project.

WHAT YOU GET:

I have created some valuable perks for your donation to this project such as getting your own limited edition poster reprints from the show- or even a full size canvas reproduction of your favorite piece.  You can also sponsor the production of a specific piece or sponsor the costs of printing the wall graphics or show flyers.  You may also give without receiving a perk in return. 

In the end whether you receive a perk or not, the bigger picture here is that I am inviting you to create and exhibit this art WITH me.  This is about us, not me.  And it is about all of us coming together to honor a shared Experience bigger than all of us.

DEADLINE:

We need to raise this money ASAP so I can put a deposit down for getting these canvases printed and hung in time for an opening party!  I have left this campaign open until July 10. 

It would be EXTREMELY helpful to get this funded by July 4th.

On a side note, I used to work for IndieGoGo (this website) as a crowd funding expert.  Statistically, these kind of projects have a greater chance of funding if we can hit 25% of our goal within the first few days. 

"If you are interested in participating in this, please don't hesitate.  Donate now and help us fund early!"

SHARE:

PLEASE SHARE THIS FUNDRAISER  WITH OTHERS IN OUR COMMUNITY!

FACEBOOK, TWITTER, TEXT and EMAIL!!!

Thank you for your love and support! Contact me with any questions you might have.  Help bring the heart of Taft to the halls of Elder.  Lets make this happen!

View the collection now via the gallery tab above or clicking here.


+ TAYLOR GAHM, artist
story_txt:
REMEMBERING TAFT:
For many of us, 2115 Taft felt like home.  It was a place of community, healing and love.  And so it's no surprise that many of us within the community at large have experienced a great deal of pain in regard to the loss of Taft.But as someone who was actively and intimately involved in the Taft community through Make Art or Die, Love Machine, Iwo Jima, Gospel Brunch, and Ecclesia, it is my opinion that although it's hard to see the building go, the heart of what made Taft special was actually the people- you and me!  I've heard some say that Elder doesn't feel like Taft.  Well, honestly it doesn't.  It feels like Elder.  There will never be another Taft- nowhere else will ever feel like Taft!  It was unique and special and we should count ourselves lucky to have experienced such a sacred space.  But what I don't want us to lose as a community at large is that although we will never replace 2115 Taft, it is within our grasp and calling to co-generate a new space- a space ripe for new memories, new healing and new life. 
What I am suggesting is that we hold the keys for making Elder a uniquely special place of community, healing and love that we can all call home.
"Because to think that what made 2115 Taft special can in some way be torn down and lost forever is to never have known the Source of what made Taft so special in the first place."
THE PROJECT:
When I found out that Taft was being sold I felt drawn to pick up a camera and capture some of the sights and textures of Taft from my point of view.  I didn't know why- I just felt like I had to do it.
With the permission of the Taft community, I captured essential snapshots of our sacred space.  Many of the images depict feet and floors- partly to avoid exploiting faces/identities within the sacred space of gatherings, but also because feet and floors are a lot of what one sees while staring contemplatively during the conversations of healing, hope and love that took place there!
The imagery in this show reflects my personal perspective of Taft- the things that I took note of and that where special to me.  I hope that when others from the community see this show, they will be transported back to a time and place not so long ago, and would somehow be reminded and put in touch with the spirit of 2115 Taft that I believe is still very much alive and well, here and now.
My vision for this collection is to bring this spirit of Taft into the hallways of Elder.  To have this collection symbolically wrapped around the entire building, embracing our community at Elder.
The premise of this show attempts to capture snapshots of Taft's visual essence, transplanting them into the heart of Elder- hence the name of the collection is "TRANSPLANT".  This collection consists of twenty over-sized canvases, each a whopping 64"x36".

View the collection now via the gallery tab above or clicking here.

This is a huge undertaking from a production standpoint.  For those familiar with my REHUMANIZE collection, this show has 2.5x more pieces, and the individual canvases are 3x bigger!
In order to make this collection come to life, we need $2,900 to cover the hard costs associated with printing and stretching 20 canvases, creating wall graphics and producing print outs for the collection.  This number also reflects a $3,200 discount I have negotiated off of the total printing cost! I really want to see this project come to life in our community and so I am fully prepared and planning to do my part for free- but I need to at least raise the base amount of $2,900 to make it happen.  Should we raise more than $2,900, I will be gratefully accepting any surplus as an honorarium going towards my personal involvement on this project.
WHAT YOU GET:
I have created some valuable perks for your donation to this project such as getting your own limited edition poster reprints from the show- or even a full size canvas reproduction of your favorite piece.  You can also sponsor the production of a specific piece or sponsor the costs of printing the wall graphics or show flyers.  You may also give without receiving a perk in return.

It would be EXTREMELY helpful to get this funded by July 4th.

story:
Dec. 1, 2013

Thanks to everyone who contributed! I was really amazed by how the community far and near came out to support the project. We got a lot of participation and contributions to this project outside of the indiegogo campaign. We still need to raise funds or in kind donations of services to bring this project to fruition. If you can donate please write a check to Hudson Valley Center for Contemporary Art and send it to me at: Lana Yu, 802 South St. #2, Peekskill, NY 10566. We still need the help with installation of the mural requiring a scaffold, contractor and structural engineer if anyone can donate their time or services. For a full list of everything we need please see: http://whatmatters.lanayu.net/how-you-can-help/

Our supporters:

http://whatmatters.lanayu.net/our-supporters/

How to donate:

http://whatmatters.lanayu.net/donate/

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Nov. 20, 2013: Please enjoy this new video created by filmmaker Larry Horowitz featuring interviews with diverse folks from the community sharing what matters. We are in the process of creating the What Matters documentary that will include your many words (much more than the mural can fit!). It will also include the process of making the mural and interviews with people like you!

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Join the community and take a moment to reflect -What matters to you? People from all walks of life, ages and backgrounds are invited to share their perspective. Over the last year hundreds of phrases have been gathered from the community through twelve live events, internet and phone. A selection of these words will be painted as a mural in the center of my hometown, Peekskill, NY. When the words are shared in a public forum it becomes be way for people to communicate their thoughts and breakdown barriers of perceived separateness in our culturally diverse community. Won't you help make this dream a reality?

Your contribution goes toward:

• Materials and services needed for creating and erecting the mural: aluminum panels (for mural), studs, hardware, scaffold, insurance, permits, paper for interactive events, fundraising costs, Indiegogo fees and Indiegogo gifts.
• Talent and personnel. Architectural engineer, carpenter and contractor to install mural and signage. Artist fee.


The plan:
Through November
Raise money, plan and design the mural. Continue to create live interactive events to gather phrases from the community. What Matter as a growing wall of post it notes are on display for you to interact with at Los Andes Bakery at 1049 Main St. in Peekskill, NY. The mural will go on the outside of the building. Also live at the Hat Factory at 1000 N. Division St. in Peekskill is an opportunity to engage with What Matters at the Peekskill Arts Alliance Art Show and Sale. All proceeds of posters and art by Lana Yu will be donated to the What Matters Mural. The show runs from Nov. 30 to Dec. 22, Sat-Sun 11-5PM. Opening Reception, Sat. Nov. 30, 4-6PM. This is a great show or sale to get holiday gifts! www.peekskillartsalliance.org

December
Paint the mural with the community at 802 South St. #2, Peekskill, NY during the month of December from 12 noon to 9PM. Pending delivery of the panels, we hope to begin by Dec 9ish. All are invited to come paint and share words of what matters to them. All ages are welcome. No experience necessary. Bring your family and friends. RSVP required so I may plan your visit: art@lanayu.net or call 914-737-1141.

December or possibly Spring if allowed by ArtsWestchester
Install mural and celebrate its completion.The mural will be a permanent fixture in downtown Peekskill at 1049 Main Street, created by the community for the community. Before the installation of the mural in its permanent location, please celebrate its completion at 2PM on Saturday, Dec. 28 at 802 South St. #2, Peekskill, NY. Open House all weekend to enjoy the completed mural: Dec. 29. 2-4PM.

Other Ways You Can Help:
Even if you can’t contribute, you can still help me with my campaign. Please spread the word about the fundraising to make this mural possible. Email your family, friends, neighbors and colleagues. Put a link to my project on your blog, website, Facebook page and tweet about it!

If you can donate materials, services or your time, please contact me at art@lanayu.net
There are many things we need. Check out out the What Matters Website http://whatmatters.lanayu.net/how-you-can-help/ to see how you can contribute.

If you wish to make a tax-deductible donation instead of receiving one of these indiegogo gifts offered here, please write a check payable to the Hudson Valley Center for Contemporary Art, a 501(c)(3) non-profit arts and educational organization that is dedicated to the development of programs that enrich our understanding of contemporary art, its contexts and its relationship to social issues. Please be sure to write “What Matters project, Artist Lana Yu" on the memo line of your check so your donation will go toward this project. The museum has generously offered to be the fiscal agent for this project.

Please mail the check to me so that I may track donations and personally thank and credit you for your donation.
Mail your check to:
What Matters
c/o Lana Yu
802 South St. #2
Peekskill, NY 10566.

Golden Artists Colors has provided paint for this mural. Los Andes Bakery at 1049 Main St. in downtown Peekskill, NY is lending their wall to share the voice of the community.

This project is partially funded by a grant from ArtsWestchester. Arts Alive Project Grants are made possible with funds from the Decentralization Program (DEC), a regrant program of the New York State Council on the Arts with the support of Governor Andrew Cuomo and the NYS Legislature and administered by ArtsWestchester.

All donors will be credited on the What Matters website. Significant donors of $500 or more will be thanked on the mural itself.

Link Up:

Official Site and Blog - http://whatmatters.lanayu.net
Facebook - http://www.facebook.com/lana.yu
Twitter - http://www.twitter.com/lanayu
Won't you share what matters to you?
http://whatmatters.lanayu.net/share-your-thoughts

I am deeply grateful for any contribution you can give.

I truly believe if there a reason to exist it is to help, inspire and comfort one another. What else is there? We are after all, in this world together.

Thanks for your support!

Artist, Lana Yu

story:
"Breaking Point" is a photographic project about resilience, and our ability to push through adversity and hardship. The term “Breaking Point” is used in breath-hold diving and refers to the moment a person submits to their overwhelming urge to take a breath. 

For this ongoing project I will photograph people holding their breath under water and then coming up for air at their breaking point. Capturing this moment results in an intimate and emotive transaction between the subject, artist and viewer. 

The first image in this series, of my great friend Emma Walsh,  won the Royal Hibernian Academy's (Dublin, Ireland) Photography Prize 2011 and was critically acclaimed in the Irish Times and Sunday Times and was also published in Manifest Gallery's (USA) International Photography Annual.  In 2013 this image will also be shown in the Royal Ulster Academy's (Belfast) annual show and Irish Museum of Contemporary Art's "New Living Artists" show along with new pieces in this series. 

This is where you come in….

Your funds will help me to:

  • Continue work on this series for upcoming show in November
  • Rent the specific camera equipment I need
  • Print and frame large scale fine art editions of my work
  • Work towards a solo show

Thank you for taking the time to read more about "Breaking Point" and handing over some of your hard earned money to help support it!  I know times are tough out there and this is essentially what my project is about. 

In return for your help I will develop work that will be impactful and poignant to anyone who knows what it's like to endure and overcome hardship in their lives. It's an important project that is incredibly relevant in Ireland and internationally right now and will be a document of this period in years to come. 

"As a document of our time, it's first class." Aidan Dunne, Culture, The Irish Times

Thank you for your support.  Even if you can't contribute please share this project with people who would be interested. 

For people able to donate, there are some lovely rewards to be had...check them out over on the right ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------>

For more information on me and some of my other projects:

http://www.erinquinnphotography.com/projects/breaking-point

Best wishes,

Erin Quinn

story:
Imagine being in your 20’s, freelancing, practically unemployed, bored and depressed. That was the state I was in some time ago. Then, my Grandmother handed me a special gift. My Great-Great Aunt Edna’s sewing box.

I looked through the old box and discovered a gift no one could have bought for me. The gift had been building up since the 1930’s from a woman in my family who passed at the age of 97 years old. Inside were my Aunt’s steel crochet hooks, patterns dated back to the 1940’s, spools of thread, carpet hooks, tapestry needles, knitting needles, pieces of lace, including one that was still unfinished attached to her tatting shuttle.

After looking through this treasure trove of items, I found out more about my Aunt's passion for creating. A light went on in my head and I set out to create my own works that would be given away as gifts. The depression I was going through began to lift and I had something to look forward to.

After years of crafting as a hobby, I have set out to create a series of books for the beginner crafter - or for the crafter who wants a refresher course. I want these books to be available for free. Anyone who feels like paying for them can, but payment is not required. My goal is to reach people who were in the state I was in and give them the ability to wake up each day looking forward to something. 

What do I need?

Most of the supplies for the projects are already in my home in my ever-growing craft storage area. I do need a better camera so I can not only take pictures for step-by-step tutorials but so that I can also create videos to go with each book. 

There are some minor costs associated with publishing the books. The largest will be to get some graphics for the covers created. They will be primarily available on Kindle and similar platforms, but I need a way to get these books in print on an as-needed basis. Why? Because I want anyone who needs these books to have them! 

But Why?

This series is truly a labor of love. I have no idea if any of the published books will make money. That's not why I'm doing this. I'm doing this to reach out to people who are in the same situation I was in. I am also doing this to prove some "old fashioned" crafts aren't as dated as you think. Hey, I'm only 30! I can't possibly do anything "old" yet.

Can't I Get This For Free?

Yes, but there's a problem with that. Let's say you want to learn how to crochet. You find one video that teaches you the basics, then you have to find more videos that are easy to understand and good quality. Those videos will end up in a playlist or a bookmark for reference. Hooray! You learned how! 

Now, it's time to find your first project. Oh, holy cow. Google has thousands and thousands of results for beginners, but which one is right? Is it really easy? Only one way to find out! What if the project you tried isn't as easy as you hoped? You wasted time and supplies. Plus, you're bummed out. I know this because it's happened to me with certain crafts. 

The Harps and Crafts series is meant to get rid of the searching. Everything is in one place. Including all of the beginner's information, the basics you need to get started and some projects I designed that are tailored to work with beginners. Each thing has a step-by-step picture tutorial and will have videos to accompany it. 

(Plus, you won't have to pay for the book if you don't want to. So it's free anyway!)

So You Can't Donate

Well bummer. That's OK. Talk about it on your Twitter, Facebook or blog. Heck, email me and talk to me. Then post that on your blog! Any noise I get will make me love you that much more. 

Being able to do this made a huge change in my life. I found myself in a better place mentally and physically. Creating these books is a gift I want to offer to anyone in the state I was in. 

I'll do these books even if the campaign doesn't reach it's goal. But, donating to this campaign will help me get the books completed faster which means I will reach more people in less time.

Can't I Get This For Free?
Yes, but there's a problem with that. Let's say you want to learn how to crochet. You find one video that teaches you the basics, then you have to find more videos that are easy to understand and good quality. Those videos will end up in a playlist or a bookmark for reference. Hooray! You learned how! 
Now, it's time to find your first project. Oh, holy cow. Google has thousands and thousands of results for beginners, but which one is right? Is it really easy? Only one way to find out! What if the project you tried isn't as easy as you hoped? You wasted time and supplies. Plus, you're bummed out. I know this because it's happened to me with certain crafts. 
The Harps and Crafts series is meant to get rid of the searching. Everything is in one place. Including all of the beginner's information, the basics you need to get started and some projects I designed that are tailored to work with beginners. Each thing has a step-by-step picture tutorial and will have videos to accompany it. 
(Plus, you won't have to pay for the book if you don't want to. So it's free anyway!)


So You Can't Donate
Well bummer. That's OK. Talk about it on your Twitter, Facebook or blog. Heck, email me and talk to me. Then post that on your blog! Any noise I get will make me love you that much more. 
Being able to do this made a huge change in my life. I found myself in a better place mentally and physically. Creating these books is a gift I want to offer to anyone in the state I was in. 
I'll do these books even if the campaign doesn't reach it's goal. But, donating to this campaign will help me get the books completed faster which means I will reach more people in less time.

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Andy Rivera. I am Elliot Fernandez's Art Representative. My job is to help Elliot focus on his Art. Here's how I am doing that 

  • Handling his commission requests 
  • Shipping out his sold art pieces
  • Finding new ways for Elliot's Art to be shared with people that can't afford a commission

That is where the birth of this campaign has come from. This Art-Book allows you to take home a collection of wonderful commissions as if they were all your own.

What We Need & What You Get

Our Goal of $750 is so we can get the book published in time for NYCC.

  • That will cover the cost of getting 200 - 20 page 5.5" x 8.5" art books
  • We have the Art-Book, Prints, Stickers, Magnets and Original Commissions available as perks.
  • If we can't get the entire $750, we can still adjust the total number of books that get printed. (Hopefully it won't come to that)

The Impact

Publishing anything costs money. This has been a dream of Elliot's for quite some time now and we hope that you can help make it a reality:

  • You will get your own beautiful Black and Red Art Book Collection that will be limited to 200 or less.
  • Before  anyone else sees the book, you will have yours in the mail. I promise that you won't have to wait any longer that the promised time of release because it is ready to go to press today!

Risks & Challenges

We know that this is our 1st IndieGoGo campaign, but we will hope you will help us bring this book to life. This way it won't be our last!

  • We are not in the middle of creating this book, it is ready to go.
  • Once this one is fully funded, we actually have the 2nd one also ready to be made!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to the campaign, we totally understand. You can still help though!

  • Just share the campaign on your social media outlets
  • Indiegogo has all types of sharing tools! 

By either contributing or sharing this campaign, we love all the support you are giving us!

story:
► WHY BY A CARGO SHIP?

The last two times, UuDam traveled to Europe and Australia by airplane.

This time, by traveling to America on a the CMA CGM A LINCOLN cargo-boat, UuDam has 3 objectives. 1. He would like to put himself in the shoes of earlier travelers (pre airplane era) to experience the vast time, space they were in. 2. He wishes to feel the energy that moves huge amount of world commerce in the expansive blue of the Pacific Ocean. 3. Perhaps he can feel the migrant story traveling to a new land from a perspective of an ocean traveler. 

Instead of jet-lag, he will probably experience boat-lag when reaching America.


The type of cargo ship artist UuDam will take to come to Los Angeles (a 30-day trip)

► WHAT WILL YOUR CONTRIBUTION SUPPORT?

The cost of this ambitious Pacific Ocean crossing and performances is above and beyond the UuDam Studio and OCMA budgeted funds. After the first round of crowdfunding asking for $19,000 USD, UuDam studio has raised $7,000 USD various ways. Then it ran out of time.

This second Indiegogo campaign is the catalyst to rally additional support needed to pay for the UuDam and his  assistant's 6 weeks journey on a cargo ship and launching the third fingertip into California ocean. By donating to this campaign, you will help fund their travel costs & equipment and provide modest housing during the 4-week long ocean travel & 2-week performance in California and airfare back to Việt Nam. Your support will also help provide honorariums for project collaborators, videographer, photographer, hotel and car rental, insurance, accommodations as well as video post-production, etc. The goal is to raise 12,000 USD more to cover that cost.  

Your gift will radically enhance the Time Boomerang exhibition project at OCMA by making it into reality in American continent. UuDam believes that art with a good cause can touch people and make positive changes. TIME BOOMERANG will.

Help us spread the word, whether by word of mouth or social networks. Follow us on our Facebook page:  

Bản tiếng Việt: http://tinyurl.com/yxoytndv 

Note: tiếng Anh: http://tinyurl.com/y23pp8l5 

https://www.facebook.com/UuDamStudio/

https://www.instagram.com/uudam_tran_nguyen/

https://twitter.com/UuDam

https://www.UuDamStudio.com

 

► CONTEXT & STORY FOR TIME BOOMERANG

 THE COW TONGUE:

The "cow tongue" -  The New York Times - A Game of Shark and Minnow - by Jeff Himmelman

In 1947, Taiwan & China drew the famous “cow tongue” (as known as the nine-dash line) to claim all the Islands in the South China Sea all the way to Philippine and Indonesia. These islands (atolls) are also claimed by Vietnam, the Philippines, Brunei, Indonesia, and Malaysia. This bold overlapping exercise of powers with territorial map on an international scale made UuDam Tran Nguyen rethink the concept of measuring. He finds that exciting when the real distances of things being measured is not necessarily reflected scientifically or lawfully especially when it is influenced by desires, beliefs & national needs. He thinks about what one did when one was a child. One would measure things around them with their outstretched fingers: the first act of almost pure measuring. That’s when he made the first sculpture in the first phase of Time Boomerang. He casted his hand, fingers fully outstretched in his childhood measuring gesture, in metal. When it was completed, he cut out the five fingertips, and moved them away from the hand, symbolically extending his ability to measure (or mark new territories). These five places could be 5 corners of a museum, a university campus, a country, a continent, 5 continents of the Earth, 5 places in a Galaxy, or 5 Galaxies and so on.

Phase #1: Cast hand and five fingertips ready for five continents

 

► INTRODUCTION TO TIME BOOMERANG, AMERICA PERFORMANCE

Over a period of several years, UuDam will place the 5 fingertips in the oceans of five different continents. 

Until this moment, UuDam has successfully launched 2 of the 5 bronze fingertips into the waters of Europe and Australia continents as part of Phase #2 . By measuring the world, the artist wishes to elevate a regional conflict onto a vast time and space where mediated dialogues can take place without impassioned fistfights based on heated patriotism. The Time Boomerang is an on-going project made up of 8 phases. UuDam is pleased to present Phase #1, two parts of Phase #2, Phase #3 and Phase #4 for the first time in Orange County Museum of Art. 

This August, UuDam Tran Nguyen would like to complete the third part of Phase #2,  bring his third bronze fingertip to America. California will be the chosen destination.

PHASE #2: The New Conqueror with a Good Passport. Part 3 of 5: America Performance  

    Phase #2: 30 days crossing the Pacific Ocean trip for the America performance - July-August

In July and August 2019, in conjunction with his exhibition currently on view at the Orange County Museum of Art,  the acclaimed Vietnamese artist UuDam Tran Nguyen will carry out his historic symbol-laden trip crossing the Pacific Ocean on a cargo ship. After that 30-day voyage, he will reach Los Angeles port. UuDam then will perform the dropping the third bronze fingertip into the California Pacific Ocean. Those two activities will complete Part 3 of Phase #2 of this 8-Phased Time Boomerang project.

As the chief critic of OC WEEKLY Dave Barton wrote “Starting with the idea that a child uses his hand to measure things—and the image of a land grab is the perfect childish symbol for an empire—the artist has cast his hand, then cut of the tips of all five fingertips. Those sculpted fingertips will be dropped into bodies of water bordering five of the continents, as a performative way to reclaim territory. It’s essentially a nonsense gesture, but just as with many useless things signifying hope, he persists in doing it anyway.”

   

Phase #2: Europe Performance (picture by Polly Yassin)

The crossing of the Pacific Ocean and the America performance later in California are continuing parts of the US debut of Time Boomerang at the Orange County Museum of Art from April 7, 2019 — Sept 1, 2019. This is a very special occasion to bring the TIME BOOMERANG's third bronze fingertip to the USA shore. Please join us in bringing this timely message of hope to California, a place that has prided itself on independent thinking, demographic diversity and home of the biggest Vietnamese-American community oversea that closely connected to the conflicts in the South China Sea, where this project got inspired from in the first place.

     Phase #1, #2, #4 of Time Boomerang installation at National Art Center Tokyo, in the         SunShower exhibition

 

► AN OVERVIEW OF TIME BOOMERANG

TIME BOOMERANG CONSISTS OF 8 PHASES:

PHASE #1: The Real Distances of Things Being Measured

 

Phase #1: Gilded bronze hand inside an engraved plexiglass box (picture by UuDam Studio)

PHASE #2: The New Conqueror with a Good Passport, 5 parts 

    - Part 1: EUROPE (completed)

On the 22nd of September 2015, UuDam traveled from Viet Nam to Sweden to launch the first of the five fingertips into the Gulf of Bothnia. The European performance is part of the TIME BOOMERANG Phase #2. During that time, Phase #1 was on display in the Miền Méo Miệng exhibition at Bildmuseet Museum.

  Phase #2: Europe Performance (picture by Polly Yassin)

- Part 2: AUSTRALIA (completed)

On the 29th of November 2015, after two cancellations due to bad weather, the second bronze fingertip was launched into the Moreton Bay in Brisbane, Australia. UuDam was part of the 8th Asia Pacific Triennial while carrying out his second performance of the TIME BOOMERANG Phase #2.

 Phase #2: Australia Performance (picture by Chloë Callistemon)    

- Part 3: AMERICA Performance (to be performed in August, 2019. This is where your funding is going to support). 

    - Part 4: AFRICA (to be announced)

    - Part 5: ANTARCTICA (to be announced)

PHASE #3: Digital Body Print - commissioned by OCMA

 

By CAT scanning his body and extracting the bone part into digital files with his initial UDN carved all over. UuDam's skeleton could be printed in 3D on demand. This mimics the old practice of many war where one need to find the reason to occupy new territory. Once the bone is ready, the artist can bury them on any territory where he wants to possess.

   Phase #3: Digital Body Print

PHASE #4: Cartography 101: Creating the Next Freaking World Order

Be our guest at the weekly breaking maps performance at OCMA.

After "conquering" all five continents with his bronze fingertips, we have the power to turn it up side down and break it up. As the old world orders are destroyed, we can created the next one. 

 

Phase #4: Breaking Map performance at OCMA (picture by Lauren Hillary) 

 

► ABOUT UUDAM TRAN NGUYEN

  Phase #2: Australia Performance - picture by Chloë Callistemon     

Crossing many disciplines, using Contemporary Dance, Installation, Photography, Public Art, Experimental Film, Games, Multimedia, Video Art, Travel Documentary, Performance, Sculpture, Bas-relief, Paper, and also working creatively with technology and new media, UuDam’s unique & thought-provoking art practice is unique in the Vietnamese contemporary art scene today.

UuDam created huge scale artwork involving hundreds of motorcycles that pump inflatable sculptures, world’s first Internet robotic crowdsourcing LICENSE 2 DRAW app that enable people from anywhere in the world to draw on one canvas placed ten thousands of kilometers away from them. He also does global travel sculpture/performances which expands the definition of traditional studio sculpture practice. UuDam’s 3 channel videos installation Serpents’ Tails weaving the rapid development of Vietnam with ancient myths from the Hindu time. His on-going 8-phased Time Boomerang project puts a fresh look on South East Asia current geo-politics situation and expand on it millions of years into the future and the past.

Born Vietnam in 1971, UuDam briefly attended University of Fine Art in HCMC in 1990 to 1993. He graduated from UCLA in 2001 and got his MFA from the School of Visual Arts in New York in 2005.

UuDam has been exhibiting at many venues of in world including the Yokohama Museum of Art, Aichi Triennale, the High Line Art in NYC, Queensland Museum of Contemporary Art (Australia), the Asia Pacific Triennale 8th, Bildmuseet Museum in Sweden, OnSite Art Fest in Taipei, Art Stage Singapore 2016, Lyon Museum of Contemporary Art, Kadist SF, the Jewish Museum (New York), RISD Museum, Singapore Biennale 2013, Center for Contemporary Art Ujazdowski Castle,   NTU CCA in Singapore, Sunshower (National Art Center in Tokyo), Kuandu Fine Art Museum (Taipei) and the Esplanade Visual Arts (Singapore), A Farm (Vietnam), Shanghai Biennale 2018, S.E.A. FOCUS (Singapore), University of Colorado Boulder (USA), Quynh Galerie (HCM), Kaohsiung Fine Art Museum and). His upcoming freighter travel from Asia to America and performance is happening at this moment in conjunction with his exhibition at Orange County Museum of Art (California)

His works has been mentioned and reviewed in Art Forum, Flash Art, Brooklyn Rail, Hyperallergic, Vietnam News, Blouin Art Info, The New York Times, Singapore Today Top Pick, Saigoneers, Los Angeles Times, Phnom Penh Post, Vietnam National TV, Art Radar Journal, LA weekly, Time Out New York, Arttribune.com (Italy), Zing.vn, Degree Critical, The Dot Magazine, OC Weekly, Art Monthly, Japan Times, Apollo Magazine, Cobo Social, Yicai.com news, etc.

He won the Jury Selection Prize of the prestigious Japan Media Art Festival 2015. 

UuDam is also a cofounder of the collective XEM artist book in Saigon.

►ABOUT THE 6 NEW EXHIBITIONS OCMA EXPAND AT ORANGE COUNTY MUSEUM OF ART

 For this second season at ​OCMA​EXPAND-SANTA ANA, OCMA will continue the strategy of considering its interim location as a laboratory for artistic experimentation, taking the idea of the Pacific Rim as a research question. “The season of exhibitions by artists Diego Berruecos, York Chang, Victoria Fu and Matt Rich, Fritzia Ir​í​zar, UuDam Tran Nguyen, and Hiromi Takizawa continues OCMA's proud history and trajectory as a leader in presenting the freshest art of our time,” says Todd D. Smith, OCMA’s director and CEO. “We look forward to a robust exchange of ideas born out of showing these artists, especially in such a public-facing space.” Located in South Coast Plaza Village, ​OCMA​EXPAND-SANTA ANA is the Museum’s temporary venue while it builds its Thomas Mayne-designed new home at Segerstrom Center for the Arts. 

 

► REWARDS

With his rich body of works, UuDam Studio is pleased to offer these exciting rewards to our invaluable backers:

 

Name recognition on UuDamStudio website ($5 or more)

 

Digital Wallpaper ($10 and $25)

 

Sticker of the world's first crowd-sourcing, award-winning art project  License 2 Draw ($25)

 

Graphic TIME BOOMERANG tote bag ($100 or more) 

 

Name recognition and attendance in UuDam’s August Artist Talk at OCMA  ($200 or more) (picture by PSA)

 

A private tour of UuDam’s Time Boomerang exhibition at the Orange County Museum of Art ($300 or more) (picture by Laurence Hillary)

 

1 sketch of UuDam’s 30 days activities during his sea voyage to reach the shore of the America ($600 or more) (TIME BOOMERANG)  (picture by Chloë Callistemon)    

 

Mock-up of UuDam Studio limited edition glass bottled sculpture (TIME BOOMERANG) ($1000)

 

Name recognition during speech on the boat, during the ceremonial launching the fingertip into the ocean. The backer who contributes $1,500 will receive a special edition hanging bronze Buddha sculpture from UuDam Buddha collection - gilded bronze ($1,500 or more)

 

A sculpted map of California as an island (TIME BOOMERANG) ($2,500 or more)

 

Join The UuDam & other VIP on the day of the performance on one of these boats (36 Tiara boat or if we are lucky, the Catamaran sail boat) along the coast of California. ($3,500 or more)

 

► OUR PARTNERS

Boat owners:

Depends on our schedule, we could be on either a 36 Tiara boat or the Catamaran sail boat to observe this whole historic performance of Time Boomerang in August.  We would like to thank them for their generous support.

 

Draco Film

Founded in 2015, Draco Film is a Saigon-based production house for films, media productions, commercials and digital assets. Not just an ordinary production house, they create, consult, and bring client's stories to life. Draco Film has partnered with UuDam Studio since 2015 in Project Time Boomerang in Tokyo SunShower, Japan.

Draco Film is consider one of the most active and dedicated Production & Post-Production House in HCMC, Vietnam. Their diverse service provide creative videos such as TVCs, Viral Videos, Corporate Videos and Animations for direct clients and advertising agencies. Their team is made up of dynamic filmmakers, designers, animator, dreamers and do. Again, they are looking forward to partnering with UuDam Studio on their next journey to TIME BOOMERANG, "Conquering" America Performance .

 

XEM Magazine:

From 2013, XEM collective with 5 founding members: Nguyen Thanh Truc, Phan Quang, Hoang Duong Cam, Quang Lam and Nguyen Tran UuDam. XEM Magazine has been featuring artists in Vietnam community and abroad  on their magazine platform. It is an experimental and photographic platform. Their support of the mission will result in the form of a special XEM Magazine edition to spread the news about this event on Social Media and XEM Facebook page.

 

► ADDITIONAL SPECIAL REWARDS

*For collectors who would like to invest and own part of or all of this ambitious 8-phased  TIME BOOMERANG project at this early stage, this is a great moment to do so. You will enjoy a special early bird investor rate. Items include videos, sculpture and all the items above and more below. Great rewards for Collectors who wish to support our 30 days trip across the Pacific Ocean and "Conquering" America performance:

Please view Special Collectors' Items below.

Launch Tube (Time Boomerang) - Plexiglas and bronze fingertip 

 

Engraved Plexiglass box + bronze hand (TIME BOOMERANG)

 

 Buddha (A Portrait of Emptiness) - Polished bronze (small version)

 

Video Serpents' Tails - 3 Channels, color, sound -  15 mins

 

 The 3D clouds (Serpents' Tails) - photo on archival paper - 93 x 140cm 

 

I Love You Forever (Serpents' Tails) - Foam sculpture photo on archival paper - 60 x 80 cm

 

No VACANCY sculpture - (Serpents' Tails) - Neon light and chromed bronze

 

The Long Serpents (Serpents' Tails) - Archival print on  paper  - 300 x 123 cm

 

Shadow Puller - Gilded bronze 

 

 World's first crowd-sourcing Robot + App drawing series (License 2 Draw)

 

Laser drawing (License 2 Draw)

 

Thinking Rock - Led light, aluminum and plaster, steel.

 

 

PHASE #2: The New Conqueror with a Good Passport, Part 1: EUROPE  Performance - Video of launching the 1st bronze fingertip into the Gulf of Bothnia, Sweden - Duration: 14' 56''

 

 

PHASE #2: The New Conqueror with a Good Passport, Part 2: AUSTRALIA  Performance - Video of launching the 2nd bronze fingertip into the Moreton Bay in Brisbane, Australia​ - Duration: 15' 06''

 

Feel free to contact us at UuDam Studio's Facebook or artist UuDam Tran Nguyen for any further information on the works above.

Thank you for your interest and support for TIME BOOMERANG - America Performance project!

LET'S BE PART OF HISTORY!

  With the team from Bildmuseet Museum - Umea - Sweeden (from the left Polly Yassin (photographer),  Brita Täljedal (curator), Thuy Nguyen (photographer), Gunnar Asplund ( (boat owner)​, Ida Hansson (video), UuDam Tran Nguyen)

 

UUDAM STUDIO 

THANK YOU!

UuDam was part of the 8th Asia Pacific Triennial while carrying out his second performance of the TIME BOOMERANG Phase #2. Phase #2: Australia Performance (picture by Chloë Callistemon)    - Part 3: AMERICA Performance (to be performed in August, 2019. This is where your funding is going to support).     - Part 4: AFRICA (to be announced)    - Part 5: ANTARCTICA (to be announced)PHASE #3: Digital Body Print - commissioned by OCMA By CAT scanning his body and extracting the bone part into digital files with his initial UDN carved all over. UuDam's skeleton could be printed in 3D on demand. This mimics the old practice of many war where one need to find the reason to occupy new territory. Once the bone is ready, the artist can bury them on any territory where he wants to possess.   Phase #3: Digital Body PrintPHASE #4: Cartography 101: Creating the Next Freaking World OrderBe our guest at the weekly breaking maps performance at OCMA.After "conquering" all five continents with his bronze fingertips, we have the power to turn it up side down and break it up. As the old world orders are destroyed, we can created the next one.  Phase #4: Breaking Map performance at OCMA (picture by Lauren Hillary)  ► ABOUT UUDAM TRAN NGUYEN  Phase #2: Australia Performance - picture by Chloë Callistemon     Crossing many disciplines, using Contemporary Dance, Installation, Photography, Public Art, Experimental Film, Games, Multimedia, Video Art, Travel Documentary, Performance, Sculpture, Bas-relief, Paper, and also working creatively with technology and new media, UuDam’s unique & thought-provoking art practice is unique in the Vietnamese contemporary art scene today. UuDam created huge scale artwork involving hundreds of motorcycles that pump inflatable sculptures, world’s first Internet robotic crowdsourcing LICENSE 2 DRAW app that enable people from anywhere in the world to draw on one canvas placed ten thousands of kilometers away from them. He also does global travel sculpture/performances which expands the definition of traditional studio sculpture practice. UuDam’s 3 channel videos installation Serpents’ Tails weaving the rapid development of Vietnam with ancient myths from the Hindu time. His on-going 8-phased Time Boomerang project puts a fresh look on South East Asia current geo-politics situation and expand on it millions of years into the future and the past.Born Vietnam in 1971, UuDam briefly attended University of Fine Art in HCMC in 1990 to 1993. He graduated from UCLA in 2001 and got his MFA from the School of Visual Arts in New York in 2005. UuDam has been exhibiting at many venues of in world including the Yokohama Museum of Art, Aichi Triennale, the High Line Art in NYC, Queensland Museum of Contemporary Art (Australia), the Asia Pacific Triennale 8th, Bildmuseet Museum in Sweden, OnSite Art Fest in Taipei, Art Stage Singapore 2016, Lyon Museum of Contemporary Art, Kadist SF, the Jewish Museum (New York), RISD Museum, Singapore Biennale 2013, Center for Contemporary Art Ujazdowski Castle,   NTU CCA in Singapore, Sunshower (National Art Center in Tokyo), Kuandu Fine Art Museum (Taipei) and the Esplanade Visual Arts (Singapore), A Farm (Vietnam), Shanghai Biennale 2018, S.E.A. FOCUS (Singapore), University of Colorado Boulder (USA), Quynh Galerie (HCM), Kaohsiung Fine Art Museum and). His upcoming freighter travel from Asia to America and performance is happening at this moment in conjunction with his exhibition at Orange County Museum of Art (California)His works has been mentioned and reviewed in Art Forum, Flash Art, Brooklyn Rail, Hyperallergic, Vietnam News, Blouin Art Info, The New York Times, Singapore Today Top Pick, Saigoneers, Los Angeles Times, Phnom Penh Post, Vietnam National TV, Art Radar Journal, LA weekly, Time Out New York, Arttribune.com (Italy), Zing.vn, Degree Critical, The Dot Magazine, OC Weekly, Art Monthly, Japan Times, Apollo Magazine, Cobo Social, Yicai.com news, etc. He won the Jury Selection Prize of the prestigious Japan Media Art Festival 2015.  UuDam is also a cofounder of the collective XEM artist book in Saigon.►ABOUT THE 6 NEW EXHIBITIONS OCMA EXPAND AT ORANGE COUNTY MUSEUM OF ART For this second season at ​OCMA​EXPAND-SANTA ANA, OCMA will continue the strategy of considering its interim location as a laboratory for artistic experimentation, taking the idea of the Pacific Rim as a research question. “The season of exhibitions by artists Diego Berruecos, York Chang, Victoria Fu and Matt Rich, Fritzia Ir​í​zar, UuDam Tran Nguyen, and Hiromi Takizawa continues OCMA's proud history and trajectory as a leader in presenting the freshest art of our time,” says Todd D. Smith, OCMA’s director and CEO. “We look forward to a robust exchange of ideas born out of showing these artists, especially in such a public-facing space.” Located in South Coast Plaza Village, ​OCMA​EXPAND-SANTA ANA is the Museum’s temporary venue while it builds its Thomas Mayne-designed new home at Segerstrom Center for the Arts.  ► REWARDSWith his rich body of works, UuDam Studio is pleased to offer these exciting rewards to our invaluable backers: Name recognition on UuDamStudio website ($5 or more) Digital Wallpaper ($10 and $25) Sticker of the world's first crowd-sourcing, award-winning art project  License 2 Draw ($25) Graphic TIME BOOMERANG tote bag ($100 or more)  Name recognition and attendance in UuDam’s August Artist Talk at OCMA  ($200 or more) (picture by PSA) A private tour of UuDam’s Time Boomerang exhibition at the Orange County Museum of Art ($300 or more) (picture by Laurence Hillary) 1 sketch of UuDam’s 30 days activities during his sea voyage to reach the shore of the America ($600 or more) (TIME BOOMERANG)  (picture by Chloë Callistemon)     Mock-up of UuDam Studio limited edition glass bottled sculpture (TIME BOOMERANG) ($1000) Name recognition during speech on the boat, during the ceremonial launching the fingertip into the ocean. The backer who contributes $1,500 will receive a special edition hanging bronze Buddha sculpture from UuDam Buddha collection - gilded bronze ($1,500 or more) A sculpted map of California as an island (TIME BOOMERANG) ($2,500 or more) Join The UuDam & other VIP on the day of the performance on one of these boats (36 Tiara boat or if we are lucky, the Catamaran sail boat) along the coast of California. ($3,500 or more) ► OUR PARTNERSBoat owners:Depends on our schedule, we could be on either a 36 Tiara boat or the Catamaran sail boat to observe this whole historic performance of Time Boomerang in August.  We would like to thank them for their generous support. Draco FilmFounded in 2015, Draco Film is a Saigon-based production house for films, media productions, commercials and digital assets. Not just an ordinary production house, they create, consult, and bring client's stories to life. Draco Film has partnered with UuDam Studio since 2015 in Project Time Boomerang in Tokyo SunShower, Japan.Draco Film is consider one of the most active and dedicated Production & Post-Production House in HCMC, Vietnam. Their diverse service provide creative videos such as TVCs, Viral Videos, Corporate Videos and Animations for direct clients and advertising agencies. Their team is made up of dynamic filmmakers, designers, animator, dreamers and do. Again, they are looking forward to partnering with UuDam Studio on their next journey to TIME BOOMERANG, "Conquering" America Performance . XEM Magazine:From 2013, XEM collective with 5 founding members: Nguyen Thanh Truc, Phan Quang, Hoang Duong Cam, Quang Lam and Nguyen Tran UuDam. XEM Magazine has been featuring artists in Vietnam community and abroad  on their magazine platform. It is an experimental and photographic platform. Their support of the mission will result in the form of a special XEM Magazine edition to spread the news about this event on Social Media and XEM Facebook page. ► ADDITIONAL SPECIAL REWARDS*For collectors who would like to invest and own part of or all of this ambitious 8-phased  TIME BOOMERANG project at this early stage, this is a great moment to do so. You will enjoy a special early bird investor rate. Items include videos, sculpture and all the items above and more below. Great rewards for Collectors who wish to support our 30 days trip across the Pacific Ocean and "Conquering" America performance:Please view Special Collectors' Items below.Launch Tube (Time Boomerang) - Plexiglas and bronze fingertip  Engraved Plexiglass box + bronze hand (TIME BOOMERANG)  Buddha (A Portrait of Emptiness) - Polished bronze (small version) Video Serpents' Tails - 3 Channels, color, sound -  15 mins  The 3D clouds (Serpents' Tails) - photo on archival paper - 93 x 140cm  I Love You Forever (Serpents' Tails) - Foam sculpture photo on archival paper - 60 x 80 cm No VACANCY sculpture - (Serpents' Tails) - Neon light and chromed bronze The Long Serpents (Serpents' Tails) - Archival print on  paper  - 300 x 123 cm Shadow Puller - Gilded bronze   World's first crowd-sourcing Robot + App drawing series (License 2 Draw) Laser drawing (License 2 Draw) Thinking Rock - Led light, aluminum and plaster, steel. 
 

PHASE #2: The New Conqueror with a Good Passport, Part 1: EUROPE  Performance - Video of launching the 1st bronze fingertip into the Gulf of Bothnia, Sweden - Duration: 14' 56''
 

 
PHASE #2: The New Conqueror with a Good Passport, Part 2: AUSTRALIA  Performance - Video of launching the 2nd bronze fingertip into the Moreton Bay in Brisbane, Australia​ - Duration: 15' 06'' Feel free to contact us at UuDam Studio's Facebook or artist UuDam Tran Nguyen for any further information on the works above.Thank you for your interest and support for TIME BOOMERANG - America Performance project!LET'S BE PART OF HISTORY!  With the team from Bildmuseet Museum - Umea - Sweeden (from the left Polly Yassin (photographer),  Brita Täljedal (curator), Thuy Nguyen (photographer), Gunnar Asplund ( (boat owner)​, Ida Hansson (video), UuDam Tran Nguyen) UUDAM STUDIO THANK YOU!

story:
Short Summary

One friend once told me:  "Going to Florence is a pilgrimage every sculptor should do at least once in their lifetime."  That's what motivated me to take a leap of faith and try.
The idea is to go on a trip to Florence - a well known city for its culture, science, art and sculpture - and follow old masters' paths and take my figurative drawing and sculpting knowledge to the next level. In exchange for your support I am giving away as perks everything I'll create in that time period.
This project doesn't have a world changing magnitude but we never know whether its ripples would one day influence it. 
"Sometimes it is the people no one imagines anything of who do the things that no-one can imagine" - Alan Turing

"Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." - Steve Jobs

Who I am?

I'm a 19 year old student living in the UK, born with the dream of travelling the world, a passion for drawing, creating, expressing unique ideas and learning the wicked ways of life. I study Computer Visualisation and Animation and I am striving to reach the top of this industry and work on the next block buster movies.

To stand out as an artist, I want to study my craft in the traditional way. I've been studying anatomy, its construction, bones and their functionality on my own for a few good years now. Travelling to Florence though, studying the sculptures in real life and embracing the creative atmosphere, is what makes a whole world of a difference.

What's the plan?

Once I get there, I plan on all of my time studying and drawing in Florence's "Top 10 Museums" including Uffizi Gallery and the Academia and join the "Creative People in Florence" community. The main activity will be studying a few good books I will take with me (Paul Richer, George Bridgman, Andrew Loomis and others) along with real life sculpture and life drawing sessions.

What I Need & What You Get

  • It is not a small sum but it is what I got when I added the flight (London-Florence), rent, and minimum living costs + any other drawing and sculpting materials.
  • Everything I create/produce in that time span will be given back to you as perks - designed to function just like in the old times: when an artist was being sponsored to create, discover and become better at his craft.
  • If I don't manage to reach the goal, I will spend less time there - from the initial 3 weeks to 1 week or so. 

The Intended Outcome

The whole project is an investment in the creation of a more skilled and valuable artist in exchange for authentic studies, drawings, sketches, sculptures which represent the record of becoming such an artist. 
Besides the perks, I will be sharing on social media my every day activities so that backers and followers can track my progress and see what I see, but also for keeping a digital journal.

Risks & Challenges

This would be the start of a larger journey in my career and life.
  • After the campaign ends, one challenge will be to find an affordable and safe place to live with the money raised.
  • Other than that, it will be all about learning as much as I can from the journey and using that knowledge to share meaningful art with the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spreading the word is always a great help! Share it with your friends on your social platforms if I convinced you it's something fresh and worth supporting! 


That's all, thanks for reading it through! :)

story:
The new mural will appear behind the Co-op to enhance the backspace, which will serve as a future outdoor café.

Born and raised in Dominica and an academically trained artist, Gharan brings vibrant colors inspired by his island upbringing to his paintings and sculptures. He’s also deeply connected to the land as a landscaper, vegetable and cocoa grower, and he has long been involved with the Co-op as a member-owner and as a former staff and board member.

Please help us bring Gharan’s large-scale work to life with a donation today. Fundraising goal: $2500!

 

Gharan, Amy and Julia discussing mural ideas.

 

Gharan's conceptual sketch of the mural.

Across the country, alleyways like the one behind the co-op are being revitalized in exciting ways that add beauty and culture to formerly overlooked areas and grow local business. We think this mural has the potential to start something similar in this wonderful corner of downtown Plattsburgh.

story:
The Eastside Actor's Lab was started by Kjerstine Anderson and Trent Latta when we met on a commercial set and discovered a mutual love of craft and desire to improve as actors.  Being both residents of the eastside, we started meeting weekly to build our skills and talk about our future creative hopes and dreams.  As we worked, we thought that maybe others would benefit from our meetings, and decided to reach out to other actors and see if they might be interested.

We have been overwhelmed by the inquiries for our group, and have developed two six-week series in Meisner technique; offering them for free to actors who live on (or would like to commute to) the eastside.  

We are passionate about bringing more theater art to the Eastside (the area east of Seattle).  There are many fewer opportunities for skill building and production outside of Seattle, and we have been overwhelmed by the excitement of artists in our community for our skill-building course.    Your donation would provide space for our artists to meet weekly and practice craft.  We are a fledgling operation, with hopes to produce work and bring more culture to our community.

We need your help to provide this service to our community and to begin to grow a community of theater and film on the eastside!  Thank you for your consideration, even a small amount goes a long way.

story:
WE ARE BACK FROM THE DUST!


It is impossible to verbalize the experience we all created and participated in at Burning Man 2016!
Some short facts below: people of Burning Man love banya, 600 of them can wittness this now (almost 1% of the official BRC census), we trained 10 great apprentices during the week - and we've been open for the whole week at BM. And yes you cannot imagine the change we all saw in the eyes of these 600. One short hour but all our love, and we are so grateful for your support and participation! If you've been there with us, please write your testimonial, that would be a really great thing to share!


And we will continue indeed, with your continuing participation. As we plan to do now, the banya will travel around the US during the festival period, so you'll have a chance to contact this art of transformation even more: watch for the updates!
===

WHO WE ARE

We are a team of global citizens, mischief makers & steam lovers, aimed to provide to the world our unique experience of the banya tradition. We would love to introduce the ancient traditon of steam healing and bodywork practices to the Burning Man community and inspire interest and practice around this area. The project is created by Steamology together with Own Way, the Russian art-group which is widely-known for such art objects as The Cradle of MIR and Own Way at Burning Man 2013, 2015,  and The Moment at Africa Burn 2016.


We are deeply involved in developing the methods of the traditional steamroom (called Banya) together with chanting, sound therapy and bodywork; and enhancing it with contemplative practices



WHAT WE DO?

We are going to build 15 ft geodome made of felt, together with a unique wood fired stove, a meditation lounge, a carbonated water shower.  Six experienced steammasters  will bring special mountain herbs mixes and more than 150 oak and birch branches for bodywork. The Banya will be located in Stories of MIR camp, Italic 7:45.

​


HELP US TO HEAL THE WORLD!

With your help we are going to experiment with an idea of travelling banya which will make this practice accesable for more people all around the world. It will also be a significant gift for our Burning Man community and family which will be able to experience it this year right in the heart of desert.


STICK WITH US AND GET YOUR GIFT!

General amount of expenses for banya construction, including transfer to Black Rock City and assembly is more than $25k. Our team will manage all the building on and off the playa ourselves. But authentic banya experience is much more than just a building: it is a soothing steam experience saturated with a smell of rare herbs and oils, followed by relaxing tea ceremonies with traditional samovar, some music and soothing massage sessions and so on. Every dollar this campaign generates will go toward enriching Steamology with necessary goods for truly priceless memories for our guests.



Tell your friends and community about us! Please share the link to this campaign to let more people know about our idea! If you also go to BM this year we will wait for you to come over and have an unforgettable Steamology time!  Our camp is Stories of MIR, Italic 7.45, welcome!

story:
Short Summary

Treasured Image's Marketing campaign  enables me to introduce my business and share my creativity with my brides in the state of North Carolina and around the globe. With your contributions you will help me reach 400+ brides at a bridal expo in NC on Aug. 11 & 12 and  also take care of first 6 months of monthly operating cost ( such as website, picture storage portal, etc)  to keep the marketing to brides, families, photographers, around the world via website, social media, and Etsy. Some say why a Wedding Show this early, I say why not!!

What We Need & What You Get

  • Requested Funding: $3000
    • Raised capital will take care of the following: (3) sample photo albums, placement in Southern Bride Wedding Show by Forever Bridal, marketing paraphernalia(business cards, banner, shirts, trinkets for brides, booth decor), web & e-mail hosting fee, dropbox photo storage
  • Perks: Anyone contributing less than $100 will receive a personalized thank you message, $100+ will receive a TI T-shirt and 20% off coupon for album or photo book, 1st $500 contributor will receive 49% discount for a LUXE photo album (with choice to opt out), 1st (2) people to give $250 will receive a 49% discount toward a CLASSIC photo album (with choice to opt out). 
  • If the full $3000 is not reached contributions any contributions received will go toward operating cost and one or multiple marketing tactics.

The Impact

Everyday people take photos of themselves and loved ones and most of the times the images are kept on the computer. Our albums will provide the world with an album that will showcase their most treasured memories and a heirloom album that they can pass down from generation to generation .

Although this is my first official online business and big trade show, my 12+ experience working for Corporate America, being a natural at marketing, and holding a bachelor's degree in Marketing  has primed me with the skill set and tools needed to make this business and marketing tactics a success .

Risks & Challenges

Although the possible hurdle of not selling any albums I plan to evaluate my marketing tactics monthly and try new tactics even when sales are flowing. I plan to continue to market maybe in a different forum,  conducts surveys on the why not, restructure the marketing plan, and try different techniques until I find one that works. Also, gorilla, word of mouth, marketing will be may best friend during those potential challenging times.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can not contribute $100+, $25 or $50 will help. But, if you can not contribute anything of monetary value just marketing the website on social media accounts ( Facebook, Instagram,  Twitter) and mentioning it to those you know who need this type of product will help provide Treasured Image publicity it needs.

At this time I am not asking to share this campaign on social media platforms outside of my core network.
