Some say why a Wedding Show this early, I say why not!!

What We Need & What You Get

Requested Funding: $3000Raised capital will take care of the following: (3) sample photo albums, placement in Southern Bride Wedding Show by Forever Bridal, marketing paraphernalia(business cards, banner, shirts, trinkets for brides, booth decor), web & e-mail hosting fee, dropbox photo storage

Perks: Anyone contributing less than $100 will receive a personalized thank you message, $100+ will receive a TI T-shirt and 20% off coupon for album or photo book, 1st $500 contributor will receive 49% discount for a LUXE photo album (with choice to opt out), 1st (2) people to give $250 will receive a 49% discount toward a CLASSIC photo album (with choice to opt out). 
If the full $3000 is not reached contributions any contributions received will go toward operating cost and one or multiple marketing tactics.


The Impact
Everyday people take photos of themselves and loved ones and most of the times the images are kept on the computer. Our albums will provide the world with an album that will showcase their most treasured memories and a heirloom album that they can pass down from generation to generation .
Although this is my first official online business and big trade show, my 12+ experience working for Corporate America, being a natural at marketing, and holding a bachelor's degree in Marketing  has primed me with the skill set and tools needed to make this business and marketing tactics a success .

Risks & Challenges
Although the possible hurdle of not selling any albums I plan to evaluate my marketing tactics monthly and try new tactics even when sales are flowing. I plan to continue to market maybe in a different forum,  conducts surveys on the why not, restructure the marketing plan, and try different techniques until I find one that works. Also, gorilla, word of mouth, marketing will be may best friend during those potential challenging times.

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can not contribute $100+, $25 or $50 will help. But, if you can not contribute anything of monetary value just marketing the website on social media accounts ( Facebook, Instagram,  Twitter) and mentioning it to those you know who need this type of product will help provide Treasured Image publicity it needs.
At this time I am not asking to share this campaign on social media platforms outside of my core network.

story:
Thank you to everyone who assisted in making this happen! Thank you Takach Press!! Thank you Hannah March Sanders and Blake Sanders, we did it!!!!!  Thank You to all the Artists and contributors!!  Press release from UPRRP coming soon 

Let's Leave A Press in Puerto Rico!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Members of the Southern Graphics Conference International have launched a crowdfunding campaign to purchase a press for the University of Puerto Rico Rio Piedras (UPRRP) printshop, led by Professor Martin Garcia-Rivera. The Printmaking Conference in San Juan, April 1-4, 2020, is the perfect opportunity to learn of the rich printmaking history in Puerto Rico and to give back to our hosts, who have faced many challenges in recent years.

Martin Garcia- Rivera has been teaching at UPRRP since 1993 and engages with the community in many projects. Following Hurricane Maria, his school lost one third of its student body, and many facilities were destroyed. The printmaking area will not have funding to purchase a new press in any foreseeable future.

What We Need & What You Get!

We need to raise an incredible amount to purchase a press and transport that heavy machine to San Juan! We will be posting Print Perks on social media and will update it weekly!!!

  • Ideally, we would like to raise $15,000 to purchase a new press. However, the amount raised will determine the size of the press we are able to leave! 
  • We have Print Perks!! Artists and publishers have provided amazing Print Packs from Printers of prominence and publishers too!
  • We have Print Packs from faculty and alum from historic programs as well as other unique perks!! 
  • We have Skateboard Press by the FAU Print Club and T-shirt Print Packs from Drive By Press!
  • If we do not reach the goal for a press of the size that would benefit the program, the funds will be used for shop items of need at UPRRP such as brayers, Ink, paper, copper plates, etc.

The Impact

This campaign will benefit the printmakers of tomorrow in San Juan and enable Professor Martin Garcia-Rivera and UPRRP to continue the tradition of printmaking at that program where funding for a new press is non-existent. 

  • The devastation caused by Hurricane Maria is a great challenge, to both the government and private sector. The arts are often the last and least funded.
  • Printmakers coming together for a cause will hopefully set a precedent for us to continue to assist printmakers and places in need.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge is getting the press there. The more we raise, the bigger the press, but also the higher the transportation expense.

  • We will hit a shipping weight threshold where press size will not matter. So, once we've raised the funds for a new press we must also calculate shipping.
  • We have not yet been contacted by any press manufacturers and are hoping to partner with press suppliers!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute please help us by sharing our posts to get our message out to a broader audience!

  • Please use the indiegogo share tools!

story:
I am looking to raise 4,600$ to help cover the cost of producing Paul McClampy. It will cover mold production, vinyl production, and shipping​

 

Hi! My name is Nathan Mendel, I am a Brooklyn based animator, beetle fan, and collector of vinyl toys. I am trying to raise funds to create my very own soft vinyl toy. It is based on a design I made as a pin last year. This will be my first venture into toy making and I am so excited to bring this little guy to fellow collectors!

 

Paul is a groovy little dude and the strongest and most musically gifted of any Beetle. Paul started out as a silly sketch in my journal. I liked him so much I made him a pin. I thought it would be a neat challenge to make a figure that retained a graphic look. His pincers are poseable and give him the ability to change expression! He stands at 5 inches tall.

 

I currently am working with a manufacturer that has created toys for other artists I know. The only risk/challenge currently is potential delays in production and shipping due to Covid-19. I am otherwise confident this project will go smoothly!

story:
Short Summary

We are Giorgia Valenti, Maria Müller, Ana Moioli and Isabella Uzcátegui – four international, ambitious, and aspiring female theater professionals who are passionate about elevating minority voices on stage in America. 

Our next show is coming up at The Tank on Feb 22nd, 24th and 25th! Please be there. Here is the ticket link: 

https://thetanknyc.org/calendar-1/onhowtobeamon...

https://thetanknyc.org/calendar-1/onhowtobeamon...

https://thetanknyc.org/calendar-1/onhowtobeamon...

https://www.facebook.com/events/587158698505367/

We started Et Alia to create a space for up-and-coming internationals in the arts to share their worldview with others and to bring people together from all cultures, communities, and ways of life. We like to say that while we may speak different languages, art speaks to everyone in a language they can understand. We hope to communicate the beautiful language of art to our audiences in 2020 and beyond.

We’ve mounted three original shows in New York City so far, and hope to bring many more to the stage this year. 

Your contributions will help fund our 2020 season and give a voice and a stage to American foreigners, immigrants, and other minorities through our theater company.


What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $3,500 or more to fund the following:

1) Administration costs, like accounting fees (15% of the budget)

2) Basic marketing needs, i.e. website maintenance (15% of the budget)

3) Production costs, like set design, props, lighting, costumes, and artist payment (70% of the budget)

 

We’ve set up some perks for this project to show our appreciation for your contribution, but know that no dollar amount is too small.

 

We already have two performances planned for this Spring: On How To Be a Monster, by Maria Müller, and Lolique, by Isabella Uzcátegui. So now, we are looking to support growing and struggling artists just like us. Your contributions will help us expand as a company, hire new members to our team and improve the aesthetic quality of our productions.

 

The Impact

The stories we want to show our audience come from the countries we have lived in and the experiences we share of feeling foreign in an unknown land. We have a lot to say, and we want to use our voices to explore viewpoints that the New York audience may not have been exposed to yet. 

In the Fall, we had two successful events. One was Running in Place at Dixon Place, premiering the work of the Indian playwright Hasnain Shaikh and exploring the themes of love and loss. The second was the first staged reading of Maria Müller's play On How To Be A Monster, directed by Patricia Marjorie, which involved many new artists from very diverse backgrounds. We also opened the floor for other artists in the audience to share their own work and look for collaborators in an open-mic following the reading. We want to connect people and create a powerful creative community!

Because of our lack of resources, we had to use our own props and costumes, we could not get ideal rehearsal space, we had a limited team of collaborators and we were only able to do a single performance of each. If we had the resources to reach a larger audience and explore our creativities with no financial restrictions, we would make a much stronger impact on the NYC art scene than we already have been making.

 

Risks & Challenges

Putting up a show is not an easy task. Making art takes time and money. It also takes passion, network, patience, teamwork, and hustle. We managed to put up three shows without any financial support, so we can proudly promise you we have all the other qualities necessary to overcome the challenges. 

If there weren't any risks to the art world we would be lying to you. It is possible that the money we receive from you may not be used immediately. There are so many factors we depend on as a company (spaces, actors, directors, lights, people's lives outside the theater, etc.), that it is hard to imagine a smooth process when putting up a new show. However, we can assure you that we are all very eager and that we have overcome many obstacles during the Fall - even without funding! Our strength is our unity and our ability to work together as a team.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give us your financial support at this moment, no worries! There are still things you can do to help: follow us on our Social Media, share this campaign, ask your friends to help us, or reach out to us if you know of any grants or opportunities. And, if you are interested in our mission, we readily accept the help of other passionate individuals like us.

And, if you are interested in our mission, we readily accept the help of other passionate individuals like us.

story:
Why support Artworld?

Artists work full time at a profession. They hold down jobs. They derive little from their vocation, their passion for art. And while interest in art is near universal, owning an original work remains an aspiration. Beyond ordinary reach.

How to change things? How to increase the remuneration of artists? How to increase the ownership of art? By building a community. By creating a market in affordable art.

My name is Keith McFarlane and I’m the owner of Negative Entropy BV, a one-man business based in Amsterdam and specialising in the arts. Having spent years in industry, and much of my life devoted to the sciences, I find my passion for the arts rekindled.

For the last eighteen months I been talking to artists, formulating ideas, reaching out to institutions, thinking & planning, designing & developing software, setting up a virtual community, corresponding with artists, artists from across the world. This I have done without payment. Neither have I sought commercial backing. Artworld was conceived as a community project, strictly pro bono for the artists, and at cost to the community as a whole.

The project funding will be raised by crowd-funding, from app-users, and from an annual subscription from participating galleries and commercial institutions. The artists will always pay nothing, as will schools and public exhibitions. App-users will download Artworld for free, in line with the general "best practice” on the App Store and to encourage participation. That means using in-app purchases to unlock "premium" features most useful to serious buyers and collectors.

What is Artworld?

Artworld is a community of artists, galleries, art-lovers, art-buyers and collectors. We're on Facebook and the App Store. We are 5,000: from whom around 500 are artists registered with, and contributing to the Artworld app.

The key to our project is the Artworld app. Artworld combines a catalogue of local art with the contacts and prices of a marketplace. Artworld uses geolocation to present mobile-users with work from local artists. Buyers can set up viewing, arrange a visit or make an offer. All this by email or telephone from within the app itself. We have some exceptional work, well worth your attention. There is, I think, something for everyone with an interest in the arts. Artworld presents our artists' work beautifully. Don't take my word for it: take a look at our Reviews!

The community's Facebook page combines literary, editorial and critical work, community news and discussion. The page is richly illustrated with community art. (Also see our newly created crowd-funding page.)

What do we need?

Artworld must become self funding. Its activities: community development, infrastructure support, planning & strategy, development and innovation, ever-greening, listening, marketing, editing, curating and organising all require money and time. And in such quantity that my resources are already stretched!

I am asking for funds to support the continuing growth and development of the Artworld app. This work is needed in order to refine and to manage the buyer's experience as the Artworld community, the number of its artists and the diversity of its artworks, grows. The funds will be used:

  • To help buyers to find work that is matched to their tastes and pocket book. It will also be local. And how much more interesting and focused to be able to contact and to visit the artist him or herself?
  • To categorise artists as community, emerging, galleried and established; and artworks by style, by subject and price.
  • To develop an in-app purchase system offering a much improved experience for art buyers and collectors.

For a more detailed explanation and a breakdown of costs, refer to the attached Work to be Funded. Should you have questions or need specific clarification. please contact me direct.

What do you get?

We offer a unique chance to contribute to, to take part in and to influence the development of our online community. We welcome your participation and invite you to take part. If you’re an artist yourself then take a look at the video we've made for you: it’s a variation on the buyer’s video, but it’s from the artist's point of view. Artworld perks are incremental, that is by selecting a perk of a given value, you will also receive all the less expensive perks. Should the original (competition) prints be over-subscribed, a choice of two digital prints will be substituted.

Artworld offers a waiver of in-app charges as our first two "perks" for your contribution. Of these the second is the most valuable, and represents an open ended thank you for helping us build what the community will need.

For our more generous contributors we offer something tangible: a beautifully produced limited-edition print. Eight artists, all contributors to Artworld, have most generously agreed to the use of their original work for the production of a limited edition of digital or glicée prints. The edition is strictly limited to contributors to Artworld's crowd-funding campaign, and each print is accompanied by a certificate of authenticity signed by the artist. The print size is some 20 - 25cm. To choose a print, and to review the details of the digital edition, refer to our Prospectus.

Finally for our most generous contributors we offer something unique. And because Artworld is all about the artists, I thought to include them even at this early stage. It would be perfect to commission an original, limited edition of signed and numbered prints. The artist will be decided by an Open Competition, currently running, and publicised on our Facebook page. Call to artists! We invite entries for a wood-cut, etching, engraving, intaglio or relief suitable for printing on 25cm - 30cm paper, but otherwise unrestricted in technique or subject. The competition will be judged by a panel of four judges, chosen internationally, all experts in the production of original prints. The cash prize is €1,500 (roughly $2,000) for which the artist will produce a limited edition of 50 prints. There will be an opportunity to see selected "candidate" works as they are submitted. Our most generous contributor will receive the very first, the original, signed print.

We particularly want the continued support and participation of our most generous givers. We offer editorial and advisory roles that will help shape the project, help it grow. You don't have to take a larger part, but we warmly invite you to do so. These "perks" are limited in number, but they are key to the project's success. Help us with a more than financial generosity. Help us guide the community to a global future. And all this for the benefit of artists and their art.

How does this help Artists?

Artworld is not revolutionary, but it has the potential greatly to expand the ownership of contemporary art, and to increase the number of artists that can find a reward, even make a living from their art. It will do so by doing just four things superbly well.

  • Help Community Artists. Make community art far more visible. Direct mobile buyers to local artists. Help create an income for emerging artists not yet represented and largely unknown.
  • Help Established Artists. Make known locally artists both emerging and established more visible to visiting art-lovers. Draw in contacts from "armchair travellers“, galleries and institutions worldwide.
  • Help Local Galleries. Help promote local galleries and galleries with a specialist portfolio artists far more visible to visiting art-lovers. Draw in contacts from "armchair travellers“ worldwide.
  • Put the Artworks Centre-Stage. It's the ability to leaf through a catalogue of the work of local artists that really brings Artworld to life. Artworld presents art beautifully. And if an art-lover sees something he likes, the artist or gallery is just one tap away!

Other ways you can Help

If you can’t contribute money, we would be delighted if you could give us your time. Artworld needs your support in attracting artists, gallerists, art-lovers, art-buyers and collectors. There are at least a four of roles that are essential to the project. And all of them require a commitment to helping the arts' community by helping Artworld grow.

  • Art Angel: At the very heart of Artworld, this is the role for an art's activist: helping artists pool their resources, get organised, take part in the community, in Artworld and in the market for art. An Art Angel works not for profit, not for the promotion of his or her own business, but for the community as a whole. I’ve described this role elsewhere and in some detail. But it’s about approaching and recruiting good artists, curating suitable artworks, putting their work on Artworld, and supporting them through editorial appreciations on Facebook, in the social media, in print and the other outlets for the arts.
  • Marketer: We very much need help in contacting artist and gallerists with a view to getting then not only to take part in Artworld, but pass on a recommendation to others. We’re especially interested in getting coverage in the specialist magazines and press.
  • Developer: We need help in development in order to build more rapidly and to accelerate our programme of continuous innovation. The role might build to a development team leader, something Artworld will need if the project is the success it deserves to be. With the overhead on coordination with only two people, a really skilled Android developer would be the perfect choice.
  • Friend: Please express your support for Artworld on Facebook, Twitter, your blog or web-site. And don’t forget to add a reference to our community and crowd-funding page. Recommending that others make a contribution, register with Artworld or download the app, is a great help and an important step on the road to being funded.

  Should the original (competition) prints be over-subscribed, a choice of two digital prints will be substituted. 
 

  Artworld offers a waiver of in-app charges as our first two "perks" for your contribution. Of these the second is the most valuable, 
  and represents an open ended thank you for helping us build what the community will need. 
 

  For our more generous contributors we offer something tangible: a beautifully produced limited-edition print. Eight artists, all contributors to Artworld, have most generously agreed to the use of their original work for the production of a limited edition of digital or glicée prints. The edition is strictly limited to contributors 
  to Artworld's crowd-funding campaign, and each print is accompanied by a certificate of authenticity signed by the artist. The print size is some 20 - 25cm. To choose a print, and to review the details of the digital edition, refer to our 
  Prospectus.
 

Finally for our most generous contributors we offer something unique. And because Artworld is all about the artists, I thought to include them 
   even at this early stage. It would be perfect to commission an original, limited edition of signed and numbered prints. 
   The artist will be decided by an 
   Open Competition,
   currently running, and publicised on our Facebook page. 
   Call to artists! We invite entries for a wood-cut, etching, engraving, intaglio or relief suitable for printing on 25cm - 30cm paper, but otherwise unrestricted in technique or subject.
   The competition will be judged by a panel of four judges, chosen internationally, all experts in the production of original prints. The cash prize is €1,500 
   (roughly $2,000) for which the artist will produce a limited edition of 50 prints. There will be an opportunity
   to see selected "candidate" works as they are submitted. Our most generous contributor will receive the very first, the original, signed print.
 

  We particularly want the continued support and participation of our most generous  givers. We offer editorial and advisory roles that will help shape the project,
  help it grow. You don't have to take a larger part, but we warmly invite you to do so. These "perks" are limited in number, 
  but they are key to the project's success. Help us with a more than financial generosity. Help us guide the community to a global future. 
  And all this for the benefit of artists and their art.
 





How does this help Artists?

  Artworld is not revolutionary, but it has the potential greatly to expand the ownership of contemporary art, and to increase the number of artists
  that can find a reward, even make a living from their art. It will do so by doing just four things superbly well.
 


Help Community Artists. Make community art far more visible. Direct mobile buyers to local artists. Help create an income for emerging artists
   not yet represented and largely unknown.
  

Help Established Artists. Make known locally artists both emerging and established more visible to visiting art-lovers. 
   Draw in contacts from "armchair travellers“, galleries and institutions worldwide.
  

Help Local Galleries. Help promote local galleries and galleries with a specialist portfolio artists far more visible to visiting art-lovers. 
   Draw in contacts from "armchair travellers“ worldwide.
  

Put the Artworks Centre-Stage. It's the ability to leaf through a catalogue of the work of local artists
   that really brings  Artworld  to life. Artworld presents art beautifully.
   And if an art-lover sees something he likes, the artist or gallery is just one tap away!
  






Other ways you can Help

  If you can’t contribute money, we would be delighted if you could give us your time. Artworld needs your support in attracting artists, gallerists, art-lovers,
  art-buyers and collectors. There are at least a four of roles that are  essential  to the project. And all of them require a commitment
 to helping the arts' community by helping Artworld grow.



Art Angel: At the very heart of Artworld, this is  the  role for an art's activist: helping artists pool their resources, get organised, 
 take part in the community, in  Artworld  and in the market for art. An Art Angel works not for profit, not for the promotion of his or her own business, 
 but for the community as a whole. I’ve described this role
 elsewhere and in some detail. But it’s about approaching and recruiting good artists, 
 curating suitable artworks, putting their work on Artworld, and supporting them through editorial appreciations on Facebook, in the social media,
 in print and the other outlets for the arts.


Marketer: We very much need help in contacting artist and gallerists with a view to getting then not only to take part in Artworld, 
 but pass on a recommendation to others. We’re especially interested in getting coverage in the specialist magazines and press.


Developer: We need help in development in order to build more rapidly and to accelerate our programme of continuous innovation. 
 The role might build to a development team leader, something Artworld will need if the project is the success it deserves to be. 
 With the overhead on coordination with only two people, a really skilled Android developer would be the perfect choice.
 

Friend: Please express your support for Artworld on Facebook, Twitter, your blog or web-site. And don’t forget to add a reference to our
  community 
  and crowd-funding 
 page. Recommending that others make a contribution,  register with Artworld or 
  download the app, is a great help
  and an important step on the road to being funded.

story:
Welcome (serious artist face)


My name is Jon Shannon Rogers and I make paintings and drawings. I received a BFA from the School of the Art Institute of Chicago and an MFA from the New York Studio School. Throughout I have had a passion for working from direct observation with an emphasis on color. My current process is working directly from a subject for extended periods of time and then translating those works into large studio abstractions. Over the last few years since getting my MFA I have painted and taught as an Adjunct Professor living in Little Rock, Arkansas. This July I moved to Oakland, CA to join the Firehouse Art Collective.

                               

         Best Car Wash                                                      Car Wash, Fair Park & Markham

         Oil on Canvas                                                         Oil on Canvas       

         48 x 60                                                                    16 x 20                             


One of six nominations by The New York Studio School I was selected as Artist in Residency for the month of September at the Dumfries House in East Ayershire Scotland. The residency is sponsored by the Prince's Drawing School, a London based school devoted to the practice of drawing and one of 18 charitable organizations funded by His Royal Highness the Prince of Wales. The New York Studio School was invited to make nominations with four other American institutions- The Art Students League of New York, The Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts, The New York Academy, and the Yale University School of Art. 


                              

"Dumfries House is set in 2,000 acres of land in East Ayrshire, Scotland and was       built between 1754 and 1759 for the 5th Earl of Dumfries. It has been described as an 18th century time-capsule due to the fact that the principal rooms and their contents have remained virtually unchanged for 250 years."


I will be sharing the residency with three UK artists, and the residency is providing housing as well as private studio space. We will also have access to the collection of art and craft housed on the estate for the National Gallery of Scotland.

                       

                                                                  (oooh, fancy)


                      Funding Goal: 2000 Buckaroos

My goal for this campaign is to raise $2000 for use on supplies and travel. The residency comes with a generous $2000 stipend and I have saved $1500 for my own use during this time. But after buying plane tickets, paying rent while I am gone, and factoring in money for food and living expenses, my budget for supplies and travel will be a little tight. This campaign will alleviate the stress of financial strain and allow for me to make the most of this incredible opportunity.

Supplies- I have enough saved to buy basic supplies like good paper, charcoal, ink, and even a little watercolor, as well as tape and fixative and the like. This campaign will allow me to further beef up my artistic arsenal with a roll of large high quality paper and more charcoal and fixative for large drawings, like this one:

                         

                          Titian's Bacchus and Ariadne                                                                                                                                    
                          Charcoal on Paper                                                                                                                                                                       
                          76 x 82
                        

As well as bring some oil paints, canvas and stretchers, plus a full palette of watercolors and good watercolor paper to do on-site painting like this one:

                         

                          Baphuon, Angkor Wat, Cambodia         

                          Watercolor on Paper         

                          12 x 16

Travel: While studying in Italy for six weeks in 2007 at the International School of Drawing, Painting, and Sculpture, we took weekend trips from our perch on Montecastello di Vibio to see works by the Italian Masters in places like Bologna, Arezzo, and Assissi. I would like to recreate something like this while in Scotland for at least two of the weekends. I have tentatively planned to Travel to London for a weekend to visit the National Gallery and other collections, as well as a trip into Northern Scotland to see more of the country. I will be looking for other exciting opportunities before and during the trip. If you have ideas please let me know!

I also have dreams of post-residency travel. The most expensive part about overseas travel is getting to the region. While planning a two week trip to India and Thailand in 2012, I was able to extend my travels another four weeks to include Cambodia, Laos, and Northern Thailand by selling a large drawing. The money raised was less than the original ticket cost and enabled me to extend the trip by 200%! Europe is a little more pricey, but I think if I budget well and meet my campaign goal (with your help) I can travel for another two weeks before returning to the US to install an exhibition in November.


                              Rewards

In return for your generosity I am offering several perks in conjunction with the warm, fuzzy feeling helping an aspiring professional accomplish their dreams often gives:

$30 - 1 Ticket to the Opening of my forthcoming Exhibition at the Thea Foundation in North Little Rock on November 7th, 2014. Ticket includes open bar, hors d'ouerves, live music by the Funkanites, and a chance to meet the Artist.                 (20 Tickets Total)

$50 - 2 Tickets to Exhibition Opening at Thea Foundation, including open bar, hors d'ouerves, live music by the Funkanites, and a chance to meet the Artist.                  (10 Pairs of Tickets Total)

$125 - Mantis or Rhino Beetle Relief Print- Hand printed, Signed and Numbered First Edition Linoleum Cut Relief Print, unframed                                                                 (20 Prints Total)

                                

            "Rhino Beetle"   4 x 6 in                                       "Mantis"    6 x 4 in


$200 - 2 Print Suite of Mantis and Rhino Beetle Relief Prints- Hand Printed, Signed and Numbered First Edition Linoleum Cut Relief Prints, unframed                                    (5 Suites of Prints Total)

NEW!!     Ogoni Relief Print
$200- New Linoleum Cut Relief Print, 8 x 10 in. Plate Hand Printed with a wooden spoon! These First Edition Prints, made in my kitchen in Oakland,  are from a Mask on view at the De Young Museum in San Francisco. It is the first of many from this rich collection. The Mask was made in Nigeria by the Ogoni People. Each Print will be shipped unframed, signed and numbered out of an edition of 60. 

                                    

                                                       "Ogoni"                8 x 10 in

$350 - Mask Relief Print- Umboi, Biwat, or N'Tomo-  Hand Printed, Signed and Numbered First Edition Woodcut Relief Prints, unframed                                                      (9 Prints Total)

        

   "Biwat" 18 x 12 in                  "Umboi" 12 x 12 in                 "N'Tomo" 24 x 12 in


$700 - 3 Print Suite of Relief Prints from Goya's Drawings- Sword Thrust, Excavation, and La Garrucha- Hand Printed, Signed and Numbered First Edition Woodcut Relief Prints, unframed                                                                                                      ( 5 Suites of Prints Total)

         

"La Garrucha" 12 x 9 in      "Excavation" 12 x 9 in          "Sword Thrust" 12 x 12 in


NEW!! 
$1000 - 3 Print Suite of Mask Relief Prints PLUS Newly Printed Mask from the De Young Collection- Umboi, Biwat, and N'Tomo, as well as the newest Mask in the Series OGONI included- Hand Printed, Signed and Numbered First Edition Woodcut Relief Prints, unframed. (3 Suites of Prints Total)

$2000- Original Charcoal Drawing from Titian's painting Diana and Actaeon, 76 x 82 in. (1 Original Charcoal Drawing Total)

                            


Requests for which prints are received will be honored on a first donor basis for as long as they last. Support this great opportunity  while beginning your collection of original art.

All donors, regardless of donation will receive thank you emails before and after the trip with information about the experiences your donations funded as well as high resolution images of the work made during the residency. And thanks in advance for your donations. (,,,thats three thank you's!)

Whether the goal of the campaign is reached or not, every dollar donated will help buy more supplies to make work and create more of an opportunity to see more of Scotland and the region.


                              Challenges

This will be my first Artist in Residency experience and I want to make the most of it. While I was studying in Italy in 2007, my first experience working abroad, my budget was pretty tight. When the art supply company that I bought materials from had an unexpected delay completing my shipment, I was left with few choices for local art supply solutions as well as diminished funding. The stress and difficulty of working within too limited a means is something I would like to be absent from my upcoming residency. With your help I can focus on the intent of the residency and make my work!

I have experience traveling overseas and have grown adept at saving money and traveling smartly. You can be sure that after traveling in Italy, Spain, France, India, Thailand, Cambodia, and Laos, every dollar of your donations will be maximized toward the goals of art-making and art-related travel adventures.

Like everyone, I have monthly bills to pay. The big obstacles, like rent and student loan debts make budgeting very necessary for this trip. I am currently working two jobs in the East Bay about six to seven days a week. I wait tables as well as do some work with an art handling company, to be sure that my current savings aren't diminished before the trip. Without working for the month of September, I will probably have to keep up this rigorous work schedule upon return to the US. This would stifle the peak production level I will be coming out of the residency with. A successful campaign will, in conjunction with providing supplies and the ability to travel, also cushion my return financially to allow me to keep making work once I'm home again. 


If you are not able to donate, thats ok! You can still help by getting out the word. Please tell as many people as you can and be sure to use the Indie Go Go share tools embedded in the website.


Thanks for taking the time to read my campaign and I hope you will support this amazing opportunity. You can see more of my work at my website:  www.jonshannonrogers.com

story:
As the 5th generation of the Kelley clan to call Amherst home and a former long-time small business owner in town (Amherst Athletic Club 1982-2010) I know all the players both large and small.

I am a proud graduate of the University of Massachusetts, where today my personal papers are part of the Special Collections and University Archives, stored at the W.E.B. Du Bois Library.

As a professional columnist for the Amherst Bulletin for 14 years I practiced advocacy journalism, trying to make my hometown a better place .  Since founding my Only In Amherst blog seven years ago I have championed the underdog -- giving voice to the voiceless -- and shined a bright light in areas where the powerful prefer darkness.

Only In Amherst is fast approaching the one million unique visitors mark, and for the past few years has averaged 60,000 page views per month.  March, 2013 is my top month of all time with 130,000 page views due to my boots on the ground coverage of the rowdy youthful disturbance known as the "Blarney Blowout".  This March again because of Blarney Blowout coverage -- this time joined by the national media -- will easily surpass last year's mark.

Reviving the Amherst Record online will allow me a bigger, more diverse platform to better cover town government, education, and business -- seven days a week, 24/7.  The $15,000 will cover the design of the website, training and follow up support.  I have already secured the URL. 

The Amherst Record online, in the best tradition of print journalism, will strive mightily to "bring comfort to the afflicted and afflict the comfortable."

story:
If you believe that dreams come true and that a park can become a magical place... please support our artists for MAF2014!


ABOUT US

Mateca Productions was founded in 1987 by Teresa Caro Ottens. Since then, the company has presented, organized and curated multiple art and music events, such as Mercedes Sosa, Mayra Caridad Valdés, NG La Banda and Adrián Iaies, etc. Always committed to promote the works of Canadian and International artists. As part of the portfolio, Mateca Productions has also been the consultant to some Canadian companies working with Latin America in the fields of Culture, Tourism & Aviation. Mateca has a knack for coordinating challenging projects, being the right hand for some Latin American Airlines over the years, finding different venues to promote sales, emphasizing cultural events, thus creating a weave of cross promotions. She is currently working, with her own team, in the production of a new form of art festival to promote Latin American culture. Additional, Mateca offers event planning services covering all the production aspects, advertising, design, catering and performances.

MISSION

Mateca Productions Inc. is committed to support music, performance and visual arts. It has always been our aim to build strong cultural bridges that support the diversity of our society, transforming and impacting our audiences through knowledge and respect of each other’s culture. Artists have a catalytic effect, they are the hidden persuaders and those who reach the masses, foreseeing issues with more clarity. Their power is infinite. Art gives purpose to our lives, and a new dimension to our experiences. It is the perfect fit to get to a new level that is beneficial to our core. Our intellect is constantly challenged through creativity and it drives us with a different force finding the most profound feelings within ourselves. Time and space is ours and as global citizens we feel we can make formal visual statements that compel us to live our lives with intensity and constant personal development. The trans-formative power of the arts connects us. The passion inside us surfaces through the execution of work and allows precious and untouchable moments of intimacy with ourselves. It compels us to create a better world and a space that others like to visit. The inspiration of many, builds great cities that become magnets for visitors around the world. This is a celebration of creative practices. Inspiration is a joy to the soul and we hope to impact our audience, leading the way to a very exciting path. Keeping high standards, including multi-arts projects, and giving equal chance to emerging artists. Above all, to contribute showing the riches of our culture to a vibrant Toronto audience.

ABOUT MATECA ARTS FESTIVAL

Mateca Arts Festival (MAF) is a festival of World Music and Multi-Disciplinary Art with a strong Latin American identity. It includes eclectic musicians, dancers and visual artists, with both National and International presentations. The Festival will take place Saturday & Sunday, June 7-8, 2014, at Burwash Quad Park,Victoria College, UofT. This event has been years in the making. Inspired by the riches of Latin American culture, unique in its style for its Multi-Arts presentations in one location, and honouring the diversity of the city of Toronto. Approximately fifteen countries will be represented: Argentina, Chile, Mexico, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, Venezuela, Spain, USA, & Brazil amongst others. This year’s featured country is “Argentina”. Our aim is to support “Culture Days” in the city of Toronto that show the diversity of our society, transforming and impacting our audiences through knowledge and respect of each other’s cultures. We offer a variety of programs targeting different age groups and covering a lot of ground. A festival with a true and strong meaning!

Amongst the visual art exhibit, Universities of Canada & Latin America will display their work.Local community artists were encouraged to submit their artwork through “A Call to Artists”, to give them the chance to exhibit at the heart of UofT. A university that is a reflection of how ethnically diverse our city is. Geared towards creating ecological awareness, this year’s theme is: “Earth & Water”. Our Festival is an example of the strength of working together as a creative global village and building connectivity. We hope to achieve a positive social impact by facilitating a platform to:

·  Promote other organizations that help the community through the arts

·  Develop visual arts programs at Community Centres, currently working with WWCC 

·  Create more awareness of environmental issues through our festival program

·  Build more awareness of environmental issues through our festival program

With an eye for detail and community support, the sky is the limit. We are very confident that this is going to be an enjoyable celebration for all those involved and the wrap up of years of experience. The festival intends to show a new vision of Latin American Culture, with very high standards and to support organizations and foundations that help individuals, especially youth through the arts. We thank our partners: WWCC, Working Women Community Centre, Victoria College, University of Toronto, as well as the musicians, artists, volunteers and all those who worked hard in making this dream come true.

PARTICIPANTS

MUSICIANS / SINGERS

Women in Music

 Laura Fernández

Born in Madrid, Spain, based in Toronto, Canada. Singer, songwriter, pianist, music producer, painter, award-winning illustrator and designer, radio host/producer. Laura launched her debut CD The Other Side in 2003, an English language collection of songs described as lyric driven, melodic folk, rock-pop with a groove. She won the Best Soft Rock Award at the 2003 New York International Independent Music Festival, which included performances at Madison Square Gardens; she has performed at venues such as the Knitting Factory, The Bitter End, The Continental, The TD Toronto Jazz Festival, Winter folk, and the World Music Festival In Varadero, Cuba. She is on the Board of Directors of the Association of Artists for a Better World, and a hands-on Board member, media advisor and supporter of the Mateca Arts Festival.

 Luanda Jones

Emerging Brazilian singer/songwriter Luanda Jones has been captivating audiences for over a decade with her unique blend of suave, jazz inflected vocals and stylized guitar harmonies, passionately interpreting some of the South American nation’s most cherished popular musical traditions. Drawing from the effervescent wellspring of Brazil’s diverse MPB (Brazilian Pop Music) genre, Luanda colours the expansive, encyclopaedic sonic shades of her cherished influences with an unforgettable vocal charm and entirely welcoming on-stage personality.

 Rita Di Ghent

Rita's father, Denzil, was born on a homestead near Unity, Saskatchewan. When he was 15, he rode the rails east, stopping whenever he saw smoke rising out of a hobo's shack. He'd jump off the train and offer to do chores in return for some of the hobo's fare. After Rita was born, the family decided to head to the west coast, USA, to make a better life, but they stopped in Chicago to visit family and didn't venture any further. In Chicago, Rita's father drove cab and was a chauffeur, transporting luminaries that included The Beatles, Lorne Green, and Bill Cosby. Howard bought Rita a clarinet and brother, Mark, a trumpet. Rita's first stage show was at age 8 when she tap danced to Ramsey Lewis in a big Chicago theatre. When Rita was 15, she followed her father's footsteps and left home to wander.

 Eliana Cuevas

Born to a musical family in Venezuela, Cuevas grew up to the sounds of salsa, joropo, pop and Brazilian music, writing her first song by the age of 9. After moving to Toronto, she boldly began using a fake ID to play the city’s top jazz clubs despite being underage. Among her honours are the National Jazz Awards for Latin Jazz Artist of the Year (2009), a nomination for Best World Music Solo Artist at the Canadian Folk Music Awards (2008), and the Toronto Independent Music Award for World Music Artist of the Year (2007).

 Beatriz Pichi Malen

Mapuche origin, Beatriz Pichi Malen was born in the community of Los Toldos, Province of Buenos Aires, Argentina. She began her artistic career in 1990, when she was invited by the Rockefeller Foundation to attend the Fourth International Congress of Women in Manhattan. In those days, Philadelphia University offers an edition of a book, "Visitors of Light". In 1994, she obtained the top prize in the category of Vocal Soloist Cosquín Festival (Province of Cordoba) and started a series of presentations with renewed programs year after year. She has played in different festivals along the world, touring through Europe (Check Republic, Slovenia, Spain) and Latin America (Argentina, Chile, Brazil, Uruguay) within others, spreading the history and culture of Mapuche People.

 Diane Longboat & Women of Six Nations

Speaker of our Governing Council Diane Longboat, Kahontakwas, a Mohawk, Turtle Clan woman from Six Nations, is a ceremonial leader, traditional teacher of Indigenous spiritual ways and a healer. She is a professional educator, with a graduate degree in education and has taught and lectured at Universities in Canada and many national and international conferences and gatherings on the topics of spiritual renewal as the guiding force for nation building. The myriad of ceremonies and services offered by Diane and a dedicated group of spiritual leaders who have trained with her for almost two decades are now being housed in a non-profit organization to enable the work to receive donations from scores of individuals and allied foundations whose lives and work have been empowered by the connection to Natural Law and Spiritual Law blessed through the power and the presence of the Creator at the Sacred Fire of the Thunder.

 Payadora Tango Ensemble

Toronto-based music ensemble, founded in 2013 by Argentinian Bassist Alberto Munarriz, American Violinist Rebekah Wolkstein, Canadian Pianist Tom King and Serbian Accordionist Branko Džinović, Payadora performs their own arrangements of traditional and contemporary tango music by composers such as: De Caro, Pugliese, Troilo, Salgan, and Piazzolla, as well as new commissioned compositions. Faye & Bryant López: Tango Soul was founded in 2000 by Bryant López & Faye Lavin. Based in Toronto, the company was formed with the vision of producing authentic Argentine Tango theatrical, musical and dance stage work. Tango Soul produces its own original work regularly and customizes shows for professional theatres, corporate events and private functions. Bryant & Faye are traditional argentine tango dancers whose styles derive from the milongas of Buenos Aires.

 Don Naudriak

Pianist, composer, producer, arranger, music director, conductor and author. Don Naduriak achieved every honour in classical music in his youth, and soon pursued studies in jazz and contemporary music under Canada’s legendary Oscar Peterson at the Advanced School of Contemporary Music. Finding his true calling when he played with Latin music legend Memo Acevedo. Don’s love of Latin Music lead to his role as co-founder, arranger and leader of Toronto’s 14 piece Latin group Pićante. He then produced the inaugural “Latin Fiesta” at Harbourfront in Toronto. He toured with the renowned Eartha Kitt as Musical Director and Conductor/Pianist. He was commissioned to write original music for the performed Rock Opera ‘Wheel of Fire’ based on Shakespeare’s King Lear. In conjunction with Roland Canada, the TDSB and Bloorview Children’s Schoopl/Hospital, Don founded, designed and taught the music instruction program both in the Bloorview school and hospital for over 5 years. While working with and for others has formed a large part of Don’s musical career, his bands, including Salsa Con Clave, have played a major role in establishing Latin Music in Canada. Don’s current band, Xavierjazz recently released a new CD entitled “Live at Musideum”.

PERFORMERS / DANCERS

 Ill Skillz

Ill Skills is a highly sought-after group of young motivational speakers and hip-hop performers from the Greater Toronto Area. Since its inception in 2002, Ill Skillz has presented its exciting and award winning show to hundreds of thousands in Ontario, Atlantic Canada, the Arctic, and the U.S. Ill Skillz is a multi-cultural group of young people whose love of entertaining and inspiring others motivates them to perform. The message they deliver and the show they present reflect their cultures as well as their youth. Ill Skillz continues to make a difference today. We consistently and passionately engage youth through a winning combination of education and entertainment—EDUTAINMENT.

 Faye & Bryant Lopez

Tango Soul was founded in 2000 by Bryant Lopez & Faye Lavin. Based in Toronto, Canada, the company was formed with the vision of producing authentic Argentine Tango theatrical, musical and dance stage work. Tango Soul produces its own original work regularly and customizes shows for professional theatres, corporate events and private functions. Though they specialize in Argentine Tango, their productions often blend with other dance gendres such as latin ballroom, salsa and flamenco. They also offer tango instructions for all ages through their Academy in both Toronto and Montreal.

 Zíngari Flamenco Fusion

Alejandra García began her flamenco training in Albuquerque, New Mexico in 1997, and has since studied in Costa Rica, Seville, Granada and Madrid with such renowned artists as Teodoro Morca, Juan Polvillo, Angel Atienza, Sonia La Poveda, Maria  Jose Franco, Antonio El Pipa, Jonatan Miro, Antonio el Tabanco, amongst others. While based in Costa Rica (2001-2012), Alejandra founded Zíngari Flamenco Dance Studio and produced various flamenco traditional shows, and flamenco fusion shows. Alejandra also performed with the Cuadro Flamenco Aljibe and Flamenco Express. In 2012 Alejandra moved to Toronto and began teaching at the Esmeralda Enrique Academy of Spanish Dance. Alejandra also performed with Flamenguitos del Norte a Toronto-based flamenco collective, at the 2012 Montreal Flamenco Festival. Alejandra has a degree in Cultural and Social Anthropology.

VISUAL ARTISTS

 Gabriela Munguía

Born in Mexico, currently living in Buenos Aires, Argentina. She has a Bachelor’s Degree in Art, Universidad del Claustro de Sor Juana, Mexico. She is currently working as an associate Professor of the UNTREF (Universidad Tres de Febrero), in the Technology and Aesthetic of the Electronic Arts Degree. She is involved in the coordination board of MediaLab SirveVerse of La Paternal Espacio Proyecto, and she was selected to exhibit in the Interactive Program 2012 of the Telefónica Fundation Gallery. She works in the Experimental and Research Centre for the Electronic Arts of the UNTREF. She is a professor of the Multimedia Design Degree in the Universidad Maimónides.

 Ana Laura Cantera

Argentinean Inter-Art artist and Professor. She received her Visual Arts degree in IUNA (National University Institute of Arts, Buenos Aires) with a major degree in painting. She is currently doing a master´s degree in Technology and Aesthetic of the Electronic Arts in the National University Tres de Febrero (UNTREF), with a thesis on human beings´ relation to nature. She is a Science and Art researcher at IUNA and has received a fellowship from the CEIArtE (Electronic Arts Research Centre) of UNTREF. She has presented her Inter-Art works in several exhibitions in Argentina and abroad.

 Ricardo dal Farra

Dr. Ricardo Dal Farra has been conducting activities in the merging fields of arts, sciences and new technologies as a composer and multimedia artist, researcher, educator, performer and curator focusing mainly on electroacoustic music and new media arts for more than 25 years. Dr. Dal Farra holds a PhD in Etudes et pratiques des arts from Université du Québec à Montréal. Dal Farra has been Director of Hexagram-Concordia since 2012 and he is also the Founding Director of Centro de Experimentación e Investigación en Artes Electrónicas- CeiArtE (Electronic Arts Experimenting and Research Centre) at National University of Tres de Febrero, Argentina. He has presented his music, new media works, research and educational developments at institutions such as Stanford University's Center for Computer Research in Music and Acoustics, New York University, Dartmouth College, The Julliard School of Music and Brooklyn College in the United States; the University of Brasilia and Itaú Cultural in Brazil; the National Conservatory of Music of La Paz in Bolivia; amongst many others.

 Dr. Alejandra Marinaro + Team University of Maimónides

Director of Multimedia Department, Universidad Maimonides. In 2006, the “Proyecto Untitled” (Untitled Project) was created in Maimonides. It is an artistic educational group formed by university’s authorities, teachers and students of the School of Communication and Multimedia Design, which working together with artists, biologists and other invited professional acts as a link between education, science and society. Since 2008, members of the group were interested in incorporate biological elements in their works. For this purpose, they invited to join scientists, artists and researchers related with the field. It has been a pioneering group in Argentina in the development of bio-art works. During its young history, works and productions of the artistic and educational group of Maimonides University, were presented at “Centro Cultural General San Martín”, “Recoleta Cultural Center” in one dotzero events, “Eva”, “Synesthesia”, “Fuga”, “Fase” at the Night of Museums of Buenos Aires and galleries “Objeto-a” and “Arte x Arte”, amongst others.

 Mateca Art Workshops + Team

Producer in the music and arts fields, event planner and artist. Mateca Team is producing a series of artworks with WWCC, collaborative and new hybrids to be exhibited during the festival.

Volunteer Mentorship Program MAF2014

  


We would like to thank all stores and individuals that have donated gifts for the Mateca Arts Festival Online Fundraising Campaign:

Laura Fernandez, Rita Di Ghent, Beatriz Pichi Malen

     

   


*All perks include shipping costs within Ontario. If you want to receive perks outside Ontario, please contact us through: info@mateca.com. Additional shipping costs may apply.

If you believe that dreams come true and that a park can become a magical place... please support our artists for MAF2014!ABOUT US

Mateca Productions was founded in 1987 by Teresa Caro Ottens. Since then, the company has presented, organized and curated multiple art and music events, such as Mercedes Sosa, Mayra Caridad Valdés, NG La Banda and Adrián Iaies, etc. Always committed to promote the works of Canadian and International artists. As part of the portfolio, Mateca Productions has also been the consultant to some Canadian companies working with Latin America in the fields of Culture, Tourism & Aviation. Mateca has a knack for coordinating challenging projects, being the right hand for some Latin American Airlines over the years, finding different venues to promote sales, emphasizing cultural events, thus creating a weave of cross promotions. She is currently working, with her own team, in the production of a new form of art festival to promote Latin American culture. Additional, Mateca offers event planning services covering all the production aspects, advertising, design, catering and performances.

story:
Short Summary
Hi and welcome to our adventurous project. My names Tony and with the help of my lovely girlfriend Amanda we have created two deviant garden gnome prototypes.
Amanda and I met while working in a horse racing stable and have been partners for 3 years now. Amanda being an avid gardener would drag me around to garden centres every other weekend and while being bored, sprightly and mischevious I would often get sent to the 'garden gnome corner' and this is where the lightbulb moment came haha.
The intention for our campaign is to raise funds for these two erotic garden gnomes to be manufactured. The funds are essential for our first shipment of gnomes, we hope to order 1000 of each design. We are currently sourcing some cost estimates from Chinese factories.
We will make our backers a priority and will continue to do so in the future. We'll ship the gnome/s to our backers well before they are offered to the public. It is only fair that those who help us reach our goal get their gnomes first.

What are we about?

  • Our vision is to create products that are entertaining, witty and very humourous.
  • Our gnomes were created to inspire our customers and friends/family to laugh out loud, to spice up their house or garden. With so much animosity  in this world right now this is our small attempt to put a little balance back on this earth.
  • These two ingenious gnomes are just the start of what will become a collection of 15-20 innovative and original gnomes.

    Why Indiegogo?

    Although our bold idea is colossal, unfortunately our budget is not. So in order to get these gnomes to the manufacturer we need your financial support. A successful indiegogo campaign is the first step towards our ambitious project. 

     

     

    Risks & Challenges

    The main risk to this project is that (due to circumstances out of our control) the gnomes will be delivered at a later date than we planned. To combat this problem we are currently sourcing pricing of gnomes in China through a professional third party so by the end of our campaign we are ready to order.

    Thank You

    We appreciate anything you can do to help our project become a reality. Sharing our video on Facebook, telling your friends/family, purchasing our randy little gnomes and even expressing your own ideas for our next gnomes - all of these will help us begin our journey.

    Thank You     :)

    Tony  and Amanda

story:
My name is Aaron, I'm a sculptor working in London. 

In the last couple years I've struck out on a career path as an art 'fabricator'. This means that in addition to my own creations I 'ghost write' the sculptures of other well known artists. I also craft pieces for companies of all sorts. You can see some of my own artworks at the bottom of this page.

It's been a hard but very rewarding climb!

However, recently I was the victim of what you would call white collar theft, that stopped a large sculptural commission I was given from being completed. It's a real threat to my whole survival as an artist. 

The details of it all are at the bottom of this text. 

In order to recover from the theft I'm getting busy making new work in the studio in the hopes of raising enough to complete the commission and move forward with my career as an artist. 

I'm asking your support! and will pay it back with original and limited edition artworks, from prints and drawing to bespoke wood carvings and even custom designed fine furniture!

THANK YOU

You can see some examples of my work in the image gallery, or at this link + there are a few snaps below!:

 http://www.aarondistler.com



------the scene of the crime / details of the theft-----


Several months ago I was commissioned to produce a large sculptural piece for a building in central London. The commission has a tight deadline and no earnings for me aside from a boost in my reputation as an artist and maker. 

The piece demanded metal work that I subcontracted out to a small company. 

The metal worker took the first 50% payment of £10,750, signed a contract and then after several months of making promises of work taking place severed contact, kept the money and did nothing!

Devastating.

Legal avenues have proven a dead end. Lawyers recommend that I let it go as to chase him would cost nearly the same 10k in legal and court fees!

The deadline for the commission is coming up fast and my client, a big company, insists that I deliver as promised. So I'm needing to get creative in finding a way to recover the funds taken so that I can complete this work which, when done, will be a visible part of central London.

I've certainly learned my lesson about being careful who you hire. 

Hopefully this story will have a happy ending!

----------NEWS! 7 December - sample of a couple of the perks!  2 of 3

One of the several signed limited edition prints to choose from:

small carving (comes with stand!):

detail of a piece in process! (will be mounted on small stone base):


------NEWS! 7 December - sample of a couple of the perks! 1 of 3 (2&3 coming in next days!)----- When the fund raiser ends I'll email a link and do my best to allow you to choose the specific piece, or at very least the series of works that you want your piece to come from!-----

---------------

NEWS! - Xmas card perk from today (nov 28)to end of campaign for ALL contributions over £10!

This will be additional to whatever perk you qualify for / choose!

story:
Hello! 

Thanks for taking the time to check out my campaign! My name is Jodie Mim Goodnough, and I'm an artist and photographer living in Providence, RI. Here's a link to my website if you'd like to check out my work:
www.jodiemim.com
I'm about to do my first artist residency, at the Contemporary Artists Center in Troy, NY, and I need your help!
http://www.cactroy.org
The residency fees are $290 for two weeks (I received a 60% scholarship to bring it down to that cost), and I'm hoping to raise another $510 ($800 total) to cover food, film, travel costs and missed work time. Anything you can give is greatly appreciated, as this is a dream of mine, and a big deal for my career! 
Please check out my video for more info, and THANK YOU!!

story:
Hello everyone this is Edwin Sheppard of Blooming Rose Promotions & Ent, 

I'm currently working on a wonderful project involving five of South Florida Poets in a very special showcase at the famous Nuyorican Cafe in New York City. Friday August 21, 2015

I'm excited about bringing Poets: Calvin "madeS.O.N" Early, QuickthePoet, Analogy Smith, Richard Wilson, and Autrell Reid to New York City for a home in home series bring talent from the state of Florida to the Empire State and bringing talent from New York to the Sunshine State. Gearing for a twice a year showcase.

What We Need & What You Get

The funds needed will help us with Hotel Accommodations, Airfare, and promotional distribution in South Florida, Manhattan, & New Jersey. We are also putting together a thank you packet to those who donate.
     

The Impact

Spoken Word Poetry is one of the largest, ever-growing art forms in world. It provides both the speaker and the listener with opportunity to engage in an exchange thoughts and emotions that is a release like no other.

This project will bring together poets from two of the nations most diverse communities with an eclectic sensibility which embraces the true essence of Poetry and Spoken Word. This art form will continue enlighten, educate, and inspire the human soul through the expression of word. Now more than ever in these turbulent  times, we need to immerse ourselves in one of man's most primal yet powerful avenues known as communication, and as we learn to interlink ourselves to each other through our humanity.

story:
PLEASE GIVE SO WE CAN CONTINUE TO GIVE.

The Secret City is an Obie-award winning arts organization that provides inspiration, community and joy to artists and those who believe in the arts.

In a monthly service that is part cabaret, part salon, part ceremony, we have presented hundreds of performers, musicians, visual artists, chefs, jugglers, magicians, clowns, dancers, poets, and films and served 1000s of community members of artists, activists, spiritualists, radicals, friends, performers and seekers of beauty. All of this at PAY-WHAT-YOU-CAN prices, for any and all who care to attend.

We also provide FREE CHILDCARE and FREE COFFEE AND REFRESHMENTS after each service.

Once a year, we ask our community and outside supporters to contribute to our annual fund-drive. This is our ASK.

Impact

We are applying for non-profit incorporation right now. In the meantime, we rely solely on individual donations.

As a community-serving organization, we are dedicated to keeping our monthly gatherings pay-what-you-can. The donations received at our service do not cover the costs of our organization, thus most of our annual income comes from other donations and campaigns throughout the year.
 
Our annual budget this year is $66,000, and that includes one full-time paid staff member, and expenses like rent and supplies, childcare for our monthly services and ofice costs. The money from this campaign will go to those costs. 
 
Oh, and thanks to our fiscal sponsor, The Field*, your contribution is tax-deductible to the full extent of the law.
 

Our Goal and Other Ways to Help

Our funding goal this year is $30,000. And ANY AMOUNT HELPS!! So, in addition to giving, we really hope you'll help us spread the word - to your friends, family, on facebook and twitter. We've got some amazing gifts from our Secret City community, too.

*Regarding our Fiscal Sponsor

The Field is a not-for-profit, tax-exempt, 501(c)(3) organization serving the New York City performing arts community. Contributions made to The Field and earmarked for The Secret City are tax-deductible to the extent allowed by law. For more information about The Field contact: The Field, 161 6th Avenue, New York NY 10013, (212)691-6969, fax: (212)255-2053,www.thefield.org. A copy of The Field's latest annual report may be obtained, upon request, from The Field or from the Office of the Attorney General, Charities Bureau, 120 Broadway, New York, NY 10271.

story:
Our Story           

[Make a point to view the above 'GALLERY' & links + Web below, + incentives]

See what a difference we've made. Look above at the joyous kids in Kathmandu, today & look in 'Gallery', which shows the same youth a year ago, though eager, needing more support.

Iam Art director/co-ordinator, Vesa Peltonen, founder of this humanitarian organization, GLOBAL ArtXchanges. We're dedicated to sending art supplies to those youth into arts in impoverished or war-torn places world-wide. We've been successful getting materials (not money) into many places, since 2005. At this time it is a 'vision', call it a 'dream', to have this progress documented in a short film, which is of high importance for the growth of our network. To travel to meet young artists we have helped and create a film we can show the youth into arts would have many benefits. I hope you will CONTRIBUTE any amount.

I worked as an advisor for the Ontario Art Council. I've had a rewarding 30 yr. career in the arts, and it's time to give to arts in the World. This organization/network can be a role model for others. We have a growing worldwide group of contacts/volunteers & associates. We've created jobs.

This campaign is much about caring, compassion & determination. We want to enliven the youth who are in small art groups/art schools all over, that have many reasons to not get proper art supplies. (we don't send money). We only send the art materials/tools to our contact person, director/instructor requests. ~ We make sure they receive it. IT WORKS!  We won't stop half way after 6 yrs. 

 

Note of Importance:'GLOBAL ArtXchanges'already helped in Africa, Nepal, to S. America, and even in N.America we've sent art supplies successfully. The youth artists send us artwork, which will be used in a 'World Youth Art Peace Exhibition' in one of our two yr. phases t.b.a.. It was an incredible feeling to have students receive proper art materials Kathmandu, Nepal. Got there in only 7 working days from the  middle of Canada, ~Thunder Bay. They are now sustaining this art program, & we do the follow up.  I started by initially using my money. Now we receive funds from various sources, such as a funding foundation, to arts councils. We seek sponsors/patrons most importantly, to sustain our mission to move ahead with the documentary filming,now, while sending materials. Next is Cameroon.

 

Response feedback: 'Lila'~Kathmandu, Nepal orphanage/school director: "Thank you Vesa very much for art pencils,paints and papers and more, that our kids have now which has made them so happy making nice art. We want to send you some pictures later. Much love. - Namaste, Lila.

 

The Funds go to 3 areas:

(1)Sending Art Supplies to Needy Youth Art Groups World-wide is ongoing, so thus we need any contribution possible,~even $5.

(2)We are doing a short film documentary, for promotion, as well as send later a finished film to Film Festivals.

(3)To create a 'World Youth Art Peace' Exhibition, from the art given by the kids, we have helped. We have already received some.

 

The Impact

This enlivens world youth, gives them hope, a sense of accomplishment, and affects in a positive way also their family, friends, & neighbourhood. Their Community will get involved, creating volunteering and jobs. We have already seen that happen, in Ghana for example. The community begins to share in the responsibility to sustain this effort. Since the young artists have proper art supplies to work with, this puts smiles on the faces of everyone.:))))) Having family to teachers begin to share in the responsibility of motivating their youth, thus enriching the spirit in and involving many in this focus of the future of their children's education.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to reach a minimum fundraising goal of $5,000. (U.S.) That is for 60 days.

Look NOW at the INCENTIVES for the various contribution levels & each one will give back something for your generosity. You can put in your own amount, press anonymous, if desire to. When you donate funds we'll need your e-mail to send any incentives to you.

See Link below. The 1st 'link' takes you to our Facebook site; be informed~become a member:

http://www.facebook.com/groups/8688770479/

Our Web:

http://www.vpeltonen.com/artworks/global-artxchanges-progress-album/

 

Thank you,       ~ Inquire by e-mail below if need to.

 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

 Vesa Peltonen :Founder/Administrator  B.F.A. B.Ed/Guidance counselor/Educator

-105 Iris Crescent, Thunder Bay, ON, Canada, 807-767-8126  ~ also Toronto, Canada

 

*Frawn Tran: Advisor/Associate: Los Angeles

*Jo Afton: Advisor/Associate: Florida

*Marina V: Ambassador, World reknowned Celebrity, singer/composer, L.A. based

*Andrea Ramolo: Canada Celebrity Endorser/well known Canadian musician, Toronto

NOTE:  e-mail: vesa_peltonen@hotmail.com

Endorser/Ambassador 'for 'GLOBAL ArtXchanges is Marina V ~ reknowned world class composer/singer (see Gallery for her pic and our web link).
Marina says,"I think it's amazing what 'GLOBAL ArtXchanges' is doing: giving impoverished youth world-wide a chance to see their potential with being given the required art materials necessary. It helps their livelihood, encourages, & gives them confidence. Youth all over get a big chance to express ther feelings through various art mediums they wish to challenge themselves in. This also creates jobs/volunteering; so important to the neighbourhoods and community in these impoverished and war torn areas. IT'S GREAT!!
Other Ways You Can Help:

Pass this message to others, add it to your Facebook page, Website, or Blog, anything that could help get attention to this unique humanitarian arts Organization.

 

"No one can take a young person's imagination away."

 â˜† T H A N K Y O U â˜† â–‘â–’â–“ â˜†  

 

E-MAIL:     vesa_peltonen@hotmail.com
